sprite.notes: This Glitch Mario has been repurposed for use in the level editor as a means of approximating Mario's athletic prowess.

sprite.name: (Unused) Glitch Player Actor
sprite.notes: <font color="red">Use of this sprite is not recommended.</font>
sprite.advancednotes:
This sprite is the most stable version of all the "Glitch Marios." (#0-#9)
It creates a stationary Player clone. The clone will not move, and will shoot Fireballs if the matching player has the Fire Flower powerup. Other possible functions are untested. It's possible the game utilizes this data to create a temporary player actor at Entrances for no-control load-ins before switching to a controlled player actor. Additionally, depending on the position of this sprite relative to an Entrance, this Player Actor can sometimes be controlled instead of the one created by the entrance.

dualbox.comment: This determines which way the spawned Player Actor faces.

list.title: Load-In Animation
list.comment: This determines what animation is used by the spawned Player Actor when it is first loaded.
list.comment2: This value uses the same list and order as normal entrances. Every value creates a character at its position. Compared to normal entrances, Mario will be positioned on top of the sprite's placement and not inside it. The 3D model is stationary and does not move.

list.title: Character
list.comment: This determines which character will be spawned.

sprite.name: Goomba
sprite.notes: Your standard Goomba. Place it in the level and it will walk towards Mario when it loads.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-order of the Goomba placing it further behind other sprites.

list.title: Load-In Animation
list.comment: This value affects the spawning animation of the Goomba. This is useful for Goombas within range of a nearby Entrance. Jumps and Tumble will result in it landing on the platform below where it was initially placed.

sprite.name: Paragoomba
sprite.notes: A Goomba with wings that will flutter towards Mario when it loads.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-order of the Paragoomba placing it further behind other sprites.

sprite.name: Unused
sprite.notes: No assigned function, does nothing in-game.

sprite.name: Basic Platform - Horizontal Movement
sprite.notes: The most basic platform in the game. Moves on its own from left to right.

dualbox.advancedcomment: Instead of the normal model, a texture from boss_koopa_lift.arc can be used. Replacing this model will result in custom textures for the platform.

dualbox.comment: This determines the color of the platform.
This determines which model within boss_koopa_lift.arc will be used. The default texture model is the Gold Platform.

value.title: Width
value.comment: This determines the width of the platform.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the platform will initially start moving in.

value.title: Movement Distance
value.comment: This determines the distance the platform will move.

dualbox.comment: This determines the speed the platform will move.
dualbox.comment2: The exact speed difference between the two speeds is a 5:9 ratio.

checkbox.title: Event Activated
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the platform will only appear if the Triggering Event ID is activated.

sprite.name: Buzzy Beetle
sprite.notes: A standard Buzzy Beetle enemy that walks towards the player when it loads.

checkbox.title: Upside-Down
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Buzzy Beetle will be upside-down and able to cling to and walk on ceilings if placed adjacent to them. If not placed adjacent, he will immediately fall and spin towards the player.

checkbox.title: Inside Shell
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Buzzy Beetle will spawn inside his shell. He will eventually climb out and resume walking, even if set to be upside-down. Upside-down shells will fall without spinning towards the player.

sprite.name: Spiny
sprite.notes: A Spiny that walks along the ground.

list.title: Load-In Animation
list.comment: This will determine which animation state is used by the Spiny when it is first loaded.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 11
checkbox.advancedcomment: Unused flag with unknown effects.

sprite.name: Upside-Down Spiny
sprite.notes: An upside-down Spiny that clings to the ceiling. They will only function when attached to flat ceilings, and do not follow slopes or walk around edges. When placed mid-air, they will fall and attack upon loading.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 8
checkbox.advancedcomment: Used in retail Ambush Stages. Causes a bugged attribute if the Spiny is placed non-adjacent to ceiling terrain with this checked. Unknown purpose.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 12
checkbox.advancedcomment: Used in Retail: 06-02. May relate to how the Spiny interacts with slanted terrain, blocks, POW effects, or causes the Spiny to load from much further away.

sprite.name: Stone Block (NSMB-DS) - Vertical Movement
sprite.notes: An unused Stone Block style moving platform. It is solid so it cannot be jumped through. It was originally used in NSMB DS and the code was added to NSMBW but not used.

value.title: Width
value.comment: This determines the width of the block. Width should not be used unless [Height] is set to 1 Tile.
value.comment2: Width should not be used unless [Height] is set to 1 Tile. When [Height] is set above 1 Tile, the center of the block will not be textured.

value.title: Width (Buggy)
value.comment: This determines the width of the block.
value.comment2: Width should not be used unless [Height] is set to 1 Tile. When [Height] is set above 1 Tile, the center of the block will not be textured.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the block will initially start moving in.

value.title: Movement Distance
value.comment: This determines the distance the block will move.

dualbox.comment: This determines the speed the block will move.
dualbox.comment2: The exact speed difference between the two speeds is a 5:9 ratio.

checkbox.title: Event Activated
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the block will only appear if the Triggering Event ID is activated.

sprite.name: Grey Tiled Block
sprite.notes: This is a resizable stone block that was not used in retail NSMBW. Be aware that you cannot synchronize this block for level-wide timing purposes.

list.title: Height
list.comment: This determines how tall the block is.

list.title: Width
list.comment: This determines how wide the block is.

list.title: Movement Direction
list.comment: This determines the initial direction the block will travel.

checkbox.title: Offset Delay
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the block will wait two game seconds before moving the first time. This is important for adjusting timing in athletic levels.

value.title: Delay Before Movement
value.comment: This determines how long the block will wait before making its outwards movement.
value.comment2: Each value is equal to two game seconds.

value.title: Distance
value.comment: This defines how many tiles the block will move before returning to its starting position.

value.title: Delay Before Return
value.comment: This determines how long the block will wait before making its return movement.
value.comment2: Each value is equal to two game seconds.

list.title: Speed
list.comment: This determines the speed of the block's movement.

checkbox.title: Event Activated
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the block will only appear if the Triggering Event ID is activated.
checkbox.comment2: Note: The block will not disappear when the event is deactivated, for as long as it remains loaded on screen. The player must place enough distance between them and the block's spawning location for it to despawn.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This determines which Event must be activated for the platform to appear.

sprite.name: Basic Platform - Vertical Movement
sprite.notes: The most basic platform in the game. Moves on its own, upwards and downwards.

dualbox.advancedcomment: Instead of the normal model, a texture from boss_koopa_lift.arc can be used. Replacing this model will result in custom textures for the platform.

dualbox.comment: This determines the color of the platform.
This determines which model within boss_koopa_lift.arc will be used.

value.title: Width
value.comment: This determines the width of the platform.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the platform will initially start moving in.

value.title: Movement Distance

dualbox.advancedcomment: The exact speed difference between the two speeds is a 5:9 ratio.

checkbox.title: Event Activated

sprite.name: Star Coin
sprite.notes: The Star Coin is a level-wide collectible. The player's goal is to collect all three to complete their savefile.

list.title: Coin Number
list.comment: Multiple Star Coins with the same [Coin Number] can be placed. However, once one of them is collected, the duplicate entries will not load.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-Order of the Star Coin placing it further behind other sprites.

checkbox.title: Falls when POW is Used
checkbox.comment: The Star Coin will fall to the ground if a POW effect is triggered. If placed outside the Zone, the Star Coin will not spawn until the POW is hit.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: When the Star Coin is collected, the Target Event ID will be activated.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 5 Mask 1
checkbox.comment: ASM shows Nybble 5 might affect something.

checkbox.title: Move up and down on liquid surface
checkbox.comment: If the Star Coin is placed submerged in zone-wide (poisoned) water or lava, the Star Coin will snap to the surface and move up and down there.

checkbox.title: Shrink bottom hitbox by half a tile

sprite.name: Event Controller - Zone Enter
sprite.notes: When the zone is loaded, all 'Zone Enter' Event Controllers will activate and modify the status of their associated Event IDs. Note that Event IDs 1-33 are stored Level-wide, and not per Area or Zone. By using this controller in a midway room, you can clear those Event flags or set them to start activated.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: This Event ID will be modified when the zone loads.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Target Event is set when the conditions for this controller are activated.

value.title: Time Activated
value.comment: This determines the amount of time the Target Event will be activated for before deactivating.
value.comment2:
A value of 0 will not deactivate on its own. A value of 1 is 10 frames of delay. A reminder that the game runs at 60 frames per second, and the game's clock is 44 frames per tick.

A value of 60 is approximately the same as a Timed Switch or Red Ring.

checkbox.title: Does Nothing / Self Destructs
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Event Controller will skip its function and delete itself.

sprite.name: Event Controller - "AND" (If X AND Y, do Z)
sprite.notes: This Event Controller works by allowing up to 4 Event IDs to be required to modify a single Event. Not all Triggering Event IDs must be set to a relevant value. You can and should leave unused Triggering Event IDs as '0'. You should also fill Triggering IDs in numerical order. Using the same value with multiple Event ID slots may cause issues in the editor.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: This event will be modified when all set Triggering Events are activated.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Target Event is set when the conditions for this controller are activated.

value.title: Triggering Event ID 1
value.comment: All Triggering Events must be enabled for this Event Controller to function. A value of 0 is ignored.
value.comment2: If you find yourself experiencing issues, please try resetting this Sprite's Settings.

list.title: Usage Mode
list.comment: This will determine how often the Target Event ID will be modified.
list.comment2:
Single Use: When all Triggering Events become active, the Target Event will be modified, and the controller will not affect the Target Event again.

Multi-Use: Each time all Triggering Events become active, the Target Event will be modified.

Only While Active: Each time all Triggering Events become active, the Target Event will be modified. When this condition is no longer met, the Target Event will have the opposite state applied to it.

sprite.name: Event Controller - "OR" (If X OR Y, do Z)
sprite.notes: This Event Controller works by allowing up to 4 Event IDs to be able to modify a single Event. Not all Triggering Event IDs must be set to a relevant value. You can and should leave unused Triggering Event IDs as '0'. You should also fill Triggering IDs in numerical order. Using the same value with multiple Event ID slots may cause issues in the editor.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: This event will be modified when any of the set Triggering Events are activated.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Target Event is set when the conditions for this controller are activated.

value.title: Triggering Event ID 1
value.comment: Any Triggering Events that are enabled will cause this Event Controller to function. A value of 0 is ignored.
value.comment2: If you find yourself experiencing issues, please try resetting this Sprite's Settings.

list.title: Usage Mode
list.comment: This will determine how often the Target Event ID will be modified.
list.comment2:
Single Use: When any Triggering Event becomes active, the Target Event will be modified, and the controller will not affect the Target Event again even if a different Triggering Event becomes active.

Multi-Use: Each time any Triggering Event becomes active, the Target Event will be modified.

Only While Active: When any of the Triggering Events become active, the Target Event will be modified. When this condition is no longer met by any of the Triggering Events, the Target Event will have the opposite state applied to it.

sprite.name: Event Controller - "RANDOM" (If X, do Y OR Z)
sprite.notes:
This Event Controller can cause one of the four random IDs to trigger if the relevant Event ID has been activated. You do not have to use all four Random ID slots, and you can use the same Event ID on multiple slots.

Example: ID A in slot 1, ID A in slot 2 and ID B in slot 3 will cause 2/3 chance of A being activated and 1/3 chance of B.

value.title: Target Event ID 1
value.comment: Not all Target Event IDs are required to be used, and you can affect the probability by using the same Event ID in multiple slots.
value.comment2: If you find yourself experiencing issues, please try resetting this Sprite's Settings.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Target Event is set when the conditions for this controller are activated.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This event will cause one of the available Target Events to be modified at random.

dualbox.comment: This determines how often a Target Event ID can be modified by the controller.
dualbox.comment2:
Single Use: When the Triggering Event becomes active, a Target Event will be modified, and the controller will not affect any Target Event again even if the Triggering Event becomes active again.

Multi-Use: Each time the Triggering Event becomes active, a Target Event will be modified. This means you must deactivate the Triggering Event ID before the controller can attempt to activate another Target ID.

sprite.name: Event Controller - Chainer (If X, do Y)
sprite.notes: This Event Controller will link two events together. When the condition of the Triggering Event ID is met, the Target Event ID will be modified. It's also possible to define a duration the Target Event will stay active, or a delay until the Target Event becomes active.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This event will trigger the activation of this Event Controller.

dualbox.comment: This determines the event state that activates this Event Controller.
dualbox.comment2: The event state must be triggered from the opposite state, first. It is specifically the activation or deactivation that is checked, not the actual status of the event.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: This event will be modified when the Triggering Event is activated.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Target Event is modified.
This determines how the Target Event is modified both before and after the delay.

value.title: Activation Delay/Duration
value.comment: The Target Event will be modified instantly. When this is set to 0, the Target Event will not be modified further. Otherwise, it will place it in the reverse state then wait a specific amount of time before modifying it again.
value.comment2:
A value of 1 is 10 frames of delay. A reminder that the game runs at 60 frames per second, and the game's clock is 44 frames per tick.

A value of 60 is approximately the same as a Timed Switch or Red Ring.

list.title: Usage Mode
list.comment: This determines how often the Target Event ID can be modified by the controller.
list.comment2:
Single Use: When the condition of the Triggering Event is met, the Target Event will be modified, and the controller will not affect the Target Event again even if the condition of the Triggering Event is subsequently met again.

Multi-Use: Each time the condition of the Triggering Event is met, the Target Event will be modified. If the delay is still running, the delay will be refreshed to its full value.

Only While Satisfied: While the condition of the Triggering Event is met, the Target Event will be modified. When this condition is no longer met by the Triggering Event, the Target Event will have the opposite state applied to it after the full length of the delay.

In all cases, whenever the condition of the Triggering Event is met (or is no longer met), the Target Event will have the opposite state set immediately, and then it will be set as intended after the delay.

sprite.name: Event Controller - "IF" (Uses Locations)
sprite.notes:
This event controller will modify a Target Event ID if matching player or enemy conditions within a predefined location.

Note: Some sprites are not counted as enemies, for example the Spike Ball. 'Loose Coins', on the other hand, are treated as enemies. Use a sprite like [396] to test what the game considers enemies.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: This event will be modified when the Location ID conditions are satisfied.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Target Event is set when the conditions for this controller are satisfied.
dualbox.comment2: For locations with an Enemy Location ID, the reverse status will only be applied when...? For locations with only a Player Location ID, the reverse status will only be applied when...? Specifically, is the reverse condition immediately applied upon level load when it's found to not be met, or will it only apply the reverse condition after the positive condition is met? Or even more confusingly, will the reverse condition be activated when HALF of the condition is temporarily met for the first time?

checkbox.title: Ignore Player Location
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Event Controller will ignore [Player Status] and [Player Power-up Status] completely when determining if it will modify the Target Event.

value.title: Player Location ID
value.comment: The Target Event will be modified if [Player Status] and [Player Power-up Status] are satisfied while within this Location ID.

list.title: Player Status
list.comment: When [Player Location ID] is set, the Target Event will only be triggered if a player's physical location matches this condition. Measurements will always correspond to the center of the player's feet and the lowest pixel.
list.comment2:
Within: The Target Event is only modified if a player is inside the Player Location.

Ground: The Target Event is only modified if a player is touching the ground while inside the Player Location.

Air: The Target Event is only modified if a player is jumping or otherwise not touching the ground but is still inside the Player Location.

Climbing: The Target Event is only modified if a player is in a climbing state, such as on a vine or chainlink fence.

list.title: Player Power-up Status
list.comment: When [Player Location ID] is set, the Target Event will only be triggered if the Player's power-up matches the one specified here.
list.comment2: Currently, Ice Flower, Propeller Cap, Penguin Suit, and Hammer Suit are unavailable to check for.

checkbox.title: Ignore Enemy Location
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Event Controller will ignore the requirement to have at least one enemy within a Location ID when determining if it will modify the Target Event.

value.title: Enemy Location ID
value.comment: The Target Event is only modified if there is at least one enemy sprite inside this Location ID.

list.title: Usage Mode
list.comment: This will determine how often the Target Event ID will be modified.
list.comment2:
Single Use: When the player and enemy conditions are both satisfied, the Target Event will be modified, and the controller will not affect the Target Event again even if the conditions later become satisfied again.

Multi-Use: Each time the player and enemy conditions are both satisfied, the Target Event will be modified.

Only While Satisfied: The Target Event will only be modified while the player and enemy conditions are both satisfied. When either or both are not actively being satisfied, the Target Event is set to the opposite state instead. Additionally, this flags the event as 'activated' every frame.

sprite.name: Event Controller - Multi-Chainer (If X, do Y THROUGH Z)
sprite.notes: This Event Controller will run its code when the Start Event ID is activated. It will then activate each Event ID from ['Start Event ID' + 1] through ['End Event ID']. While you cannot use this to deactivate events directly, if you use the Only While Active mode, activating and then deactivating the Start Event ID will cause the event controller to instead deactivate the events it just activated.

value.title: Start Event ID
value.comment: The Multi-Chainer will start running when this Event ID is activated.

value.title: End Event ID
value.comment: The Multi-Chainer will activate all Events from the Start Event ID to this Event ID (including this one).
value.comment2: The value entered here must be larger than the value entered for 'Start Event ID'

value.title: Delay
value.comment: The Multi-Chainer will wait this amount of time between activating each event.
value.comment2:
A value of 1 is 10 frames of delay. A reminder that the game runs at 60 frames per second, and the game's clock is 44 frames per tick.

A value of 60 is approximately the same as a Timed Switch or Red Ring.

value.title: Delay
value.comment: The Multi-Chainer will wait this amount of time between activating/deactivating each event.
value.comment2:
A value of 1 is 10 frames of delay. A reminder that the game runs at 60 frames per second, and the game's clock is 44 frames per tick.

A value of 60 is approximately the same as a Timed Switch or Red Ring.

dualbox.comment: This will determine if the Multi-Chainer will only run once, or if it can deactivate the events with the potential to activate them again.
dualbox.comment2:
Single Run: When the Start Event ID is first activated, the Multi-Chainer will activate all events through End Event ID and then cease functioning.

Only While Active: Every time the Start Event ID is activated, the Multi-Chainer will begin to activate all events through End Event ID. Every time the Start Event ID is deactivated, the Multi-Chainer will begin to deactivate all events through End Event ID.

sprite.name: ?-Switch
sprite.notes: This is the basic stand-alone switch. When triggered, it modifies the Target Event.

checkbox.title: Upside-Down
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will be facing downwards. Upside-Down switches cannot be set to fall.

checkbox.title: Falls
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will be movable by environmental factors, such as dropping down when bricks below it are destroyed, or moving along platforms.
checkbox.comment2: Conveyor belts cannot move Switches, even when [Falls] is set.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: This event will be modified when the switch is pressed.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Target Event is modified.
dualbox.comment2: The Target Event will be modified to the opposite state when the Timed effect expires.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Target Event is modified.
This determines if the Target Event is modified temporarily or permanently.
dualbox.comment2: Permanent Event cannot be used with Multi-Use.

checkbox.title: Disable Music Interruption
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will not interrupt the normal level music with Timed music. This setting is only applicable if Timed Event is set.

dualbox.comment:
Single Use: The switch will vanish entirely after pressed.

Multi-Use: The switch will enter a flat state. When the Timed effect expires, the switch will pop back up following the Delay setting.
dualbox.comment2: If the Target Event is deactivated/activated by another method, Multi-Use switches will flatten or pop-up on their own. The pop up effect can be used to launch the player much higher than they could normally jump.

list.title: Delay on Multi-Use
list.comment: This determines how long the switch will take to pop up after the timer expires on a Timed Multi-Use switch.

checkbox.title: Loads at Midway
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will only appear if the level has been loaded from a Midway point.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This switch will not be visible if a Triggering Event is defined unless that event is activated.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This switch will not be visible if a Triggering Event is defined unless that event is activated.
value.advancedcomment: Using a Triggering ID with Multi-Use functionality is somewhat glitchy and not recommended.

sprite.name: P-Switch
sprite.notes:
This switch is similar to the ? Switch, but it has the additional effect of causing all Blue Coins (tileset-based and sprite-based) to appear, turning empty Brick Blocks into Coins, and turning Coins into empty Brick Blocks. This additional functionality only occurs when using the Timed Event mode, but a Target Event is not required to make use of this functionality.

Do not use this switch around Dancing Controlled Brick Blocks, as the collision data for the transformed coins remains as if it were a block.

dependency.notes: Activates 'Pow Block Coin' tileset tiles.

checkbox.title: Upside-Down
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will be facing down. Upside-Down switches cannot be set to fall.

checkbox.title: Falls
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will be movable by environmental factors, such as dropping down when bricks below it are destroyed, or moving along platforms. It does not work with conveyor belts.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: This event will be modified when the switch is pressed. An event is not required if simply using the switch to activate Blue Coins, or transform blocks and coins.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Target Event is modified.
dualbox.comment2: The Target Event will be modified to the opposite state when the Timed effect expires.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Target Event is modified.
This determines if the Target Event is modified temporarily or permanently.
dualbox.comment2: Permanent Event cannot be used with Multi-Use. Additionally, Permanent Event will also permanently deactivate the background music for the zone, and Blue Coins will not become visible.

checkbox.title: Disable Music Interruption
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will not interrupt the normal level music with Timed music. This setting is only applicable if Timed Event is set.

checkbox.title: Disable Permanent Music Interruption
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will not disable the background music. This setting is highly recommended if Permanent Event is set.

dualbox.comment: This will determine if the switch will pop back up when the Timed effect expires.
dualbox.comment2:
Single Use: The switch will vanish entirely after pressed.

Multi-Use: The switch will enter a flat state. When the Timed effect expires, the switch will pop back up following the Delay setting.
dualbox.advancedcomment:
If the Target Event is deactivated/activated by another method, Multi-Use switches will flatten or pop-up on their own.

The pop up effect can be used to launch the player much higher than they could normally jump.

list.title: Delay on Multi-Use
list.comment: This will set how long the switch takes to pop up after the timer expires on a Timed Multi-Use switch.

checkbox.title: Loads at Midway
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will only appear if the level has been loaded from a Midway point.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This switch will not be visible if a Triggering Event is defined unless that event is activated.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This switch will not be visible if a Triggering Event is defined unless that event is activated.
value.advancedcomment: Using a Triggering ID with Multi-Use functionality is somewhat glitchy and not recommended.

sprite.name: !-Switch
sprite.notes: This switch is similar to the ? Switch, but it has the additional effect of changing all outlined Red Blocks (Pa1_ Object 57) into solid Red Blocks. This also applies to any outlined Red Blocks spawned by a Tile God. This additional functionality only occurs when using the Timed Event mode, but a Target Event is not required to make use of this functionality.

dependency.notes: Activates 'Red Block Outline A/B' tiles.

checkbox.title: Upside-Down
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will be facing downwards.
checkbox.comment2: Upside-Down switches cannot be set to fall.

checkbox.title: Falls
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will be movable by environmental factors, such as dropping down when bricks below it are destroyed, or moving along platforms.
checkbox.comment2: Conveyor belts cannot move Switches, even when [Falls] is set.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: This event will be modified when the switch is pressed. An event is not required if simply using the switch to activate Red Blocks.

dualbox.comment2: The Target Event will be modified to the opposite state when the Timed effect expires.

sprite.notes:
This switch, stored inside a Brick Block, is similar to the ? Switch, but it has the additional effect of causing all Blue Coins (both tileset based and sprite based) to appear, turning empty Brick Blocks into Coins, and turning Coins into empty Brick Blocks. This additional functionality only occurs when using the Timed Event mode, but a Target Event is not required to make use of this functionality.

Bug: Do not use this switch around Dancing Controlled Brick Blocks, as the collision data for the transformed coins remains as if they were blocks.
sprite.advancednotes: A brick block containing or supporting a switch cannot be destroyed by sprites that destroy normal brick and solid blocks as long as the switch exists.

sprite.name: Lava Bubble (Podoboo)
sprite.notes: The Lava Bubble (Podoboo) is a firey enemy that will jump up from the lava to the height it is placed at. It can only jump a maximum of 15 blocks above the lava.

dependency.notes: The Podoboo requires [139] Lava within 15 blocks underneath it in order to appear.

value.title: Delay Between Jumps
value.comment: This determines the delay between each of the Podoboo's jumps.
value.comment2: Each value is approximately 1 game second. Podoboos first load in the air at the top of their jump, so a Podoboo with a large delay value may not even interact with the player as they run by.

sprite.name: Thwomp
sprite.notes: A normal sized Thwomp that will try to crush the player when it is nearby or underneath. Thwomps are not capable of destroying tileset objects unless set to Crush Forever.

list.title: Behaviour
list.comment: This determines if the Thwomp will return to its starting position or if it will continue to crush the terrain until dropping out of the level.
list.comment2: If you use Crush Forever, the Thwomp must be able to fall completely through and well beyond the bottom border of the Zone, or the falling sound effect and rumble will not stop. Values higher than 2 default to 'Drop and Return'.[br]*: There is an extra collision type for which the Thwomp stops dropping and returns (SENSOR_JUMPDAI), but its precise effects are unknown.

sprite.name: Big Thwomp
sprite.notes: A larger Thwomp that will try to crush the player when it is nearby or underneath. Big Thwomps are capable of destroying certain types of tileset objects such as brick blocks and grey blocks.

list.title: Behaviour
list.comment: This determines if the Thwomp will return to its starting position or if it will continue to crush the terrain until dropping out of the level.
list.comment2: If you use Crush Forever, the Thwomp must be able to fall completely through and well beyond the bottom border of the Zone, or the falling sound effect and rumble will not stop. Values higher than 2 default to 'Drop and Return'.[br]*: There is an extra collision type for which the Thwomp stops dropping and returns (SENSOR_JUMPDAI), but its precise effects are unknown.

sprite.name: (Unused) Seesaw Platform
sprite.notes: This is an incomplete platform that functions like a seesaw. Usage is not recommended, as the texture used is incomplete. Otherwise, it functions well.

list.title: Tilt Distance
list.comment: This option determines the maximum amount the platform can be tilted while standing on it. Values are a bit similar to those from the 'length' category. Value 5 and above will cause Mario to slide from the platform if standing on it for too long. From values 6+, the platform can be tilted more than 90°. Exceptions are values 11 and 15 - they will produce stationary platforms. They can be useful if a custom platform with customizable texture and size is needed.

list.title: Width
list.comment: Value x 2 (in blocks). Value '0' has a width of 16.

checkbox.title: Event Activated
checkbox.comment: With this checked, the Seesaw Platform will spawn when its listed Event ID is activated, and despawn when it's deactivated.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: Determines the Event ID that spawns the Seesaw Platform when activated, and despawns it when deactivated.

sprite.name: Basic Platform - Fall-When-Touched
sprite.notes: This platform will begin to fall when a player first touches it.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the platform. Values not listed here result in 'Normal'.

value.title: Width
value.comment: This determines the length of the platform.
value.comment2: Do not use a Width of 0.

dualbox.comment: This determines the rate at which the platform will fall when activated.

list.title: Minimum number of players
list.comment: The platform immediately despawns if there are fewer players than specified here. Setting this nybble to even higher values causes the platform to always despawn, since there can be at most 4 players.

list.title: Minimum number of players for platform to fall
list.comment: The platform falls when there are at least the number of players specified here on top of it. Setting this nybble to even higher values causes the platform to never fall, since there can be at most 4 players.

sprite.name: Tilt Controlled Girder
sprite.notes: This is the Tilt Controlled Girder (Beam) platform that is assigned to the first player to touch it. That player will maintain tilt control for as long as they are touching it.

sprite.name: Auto-Rotating 4-Platform
sprite.notes: This platform is similar to the Reznor platforms from Super Mario World. It consists of four 6x1 platforms that rotate around the center point.

dualbox.comment: This determines which way the platform will rotate.

sprite.name: Effect - Quicksand
sprite.notes:
This will draw the animated quicksand effect over a specific Location ID. The actual quicksand sinking effect is only obtained through a specific tileset object. See Dependency Notes for examples. The quicksand animation is always placed behind Layer 0 objects.

Location Quicksand: If you assign a Location ID, you can cause sand to appear only within the chosen Location instead of across the entire stage.

Quicksand Crest's Maximum Length: The crest of Quicksand will stop drawing past 8192 pixels (512 blocks). You can avoid this by making multiple instances of Location Quicksand. Make sure that the widths of the locations are no greater than 8192, and that they are multiples of 16.

dependency.notes:
Pa1_sabaku (Desert): Object 24

Pa1_sabaku_chika (Desert Cave): Object 26

Pa1_toride_sabaku (Desert Tower): Object 107

checkbox.title: Flat Top
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this removes the animated crest effect on the top portion of the quicksand. This will cause a 'square' look.
checkbox.comment2: This should be used when the quicksand connects with a ceiling or other Layer 1 terrain.

value.title: Location ID
value.comment: This determines the Location where the quicksand animation will be created.

sprite.name: Lakitu
sprite.notes: A stand-alone Lakitu, more useful for small rooms than entire levels. Lakitu will throw Spinies (or coins) at the player and will follow the player until killed.

dependency.notes: The stand-alone Lakitu will spawn at exactly the height that it is placed and will remain at that height as it follows the player. Additionally, as it does not respawn after killed unless re-entering the zone, utilizing it for its cloud riding is not recommended for mandatory progress.

dualbox.comment: This will determine which animation state is used by the Lakitu when it is first loaded.
dualbox.comment2: Spawning from the Background means that the Lakitu will fly in from the background, facing the camera.

dualbox.comment: This determines what the Lakitu will throw.
dualbox.advancedcomment: ASM shows that odd values may differ from even values. No differences observed.

checkbox.title: Low Throw Arc
checkbox.advancedcomment: When enabled, the Lakitu will throw Spinies from a low throwing arc. This behavior looks glitchy when the Lakitu is moving quickly. It also should be noted this option is in a space normally used for events, so it may have a deeper function.

value.title: Unknown Value 7
value.advancedcomment: Related to target height when the Lakitu spawns in block form.

sprite.name: (Unused) Rising Tilting Platform
sprite.notes:
This is a platform imported from New Super Mario Bros. DS.

It is not recommended for use due to various glitches and a lack of texture.
sprite.advancednotes: Size is 1x7 blocks. The distance covered depends on two factors: Y-position and zone height. See [Movement Distance].

checkbox.title: Loads at Midway
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the platform will only appear if the level has been loaded from a Midway point.

list.title: Movement Distance
list.advancedcomment: This determines the maximum distance this Platform will cover. The platform covers 'Travel Limit' distance at value '0'. After any set amount of time, the platform will start blinking two blocks before the 'Travel Limit' and disappear once the player gets off it. For values marked with an asterisk (*), Mario must leave the platform for the blinking to begin. Once it starts blinking, the platform's disappearance can't be prevented.

checkbox.title: Invisible Collision Box
checkbox.advancedcomment: While strange, this value's function is clear: When the game loads the platform for the first time into view, and the player then leaves the screen, this value tells the game to remember the last position of the platform. It will then spawn an equally large collision box exactly over its last position. Mario cannot fall through this collision box, but he may pass through coming from below. I.e. when loading the platforms back to the original position, Mario is carried by the collision box, if he stands on it. This happens each time the platform leaves the screen. The bad thing is that Mario cannot activate more platforms when he stands exactly over their original position, where they spawned initially.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the platform begins to move. It can either be set to move only when touched by a player, or it can be set to move automatically when loaded into memory.

list.title: Vertical Movement and Direction
list.advancedcomment:
This determines how the platform moves on the Y-axis. If the value is set to '0' or '2', the platform will rise up. With value '1', the platform will fall slowly. The platform stops only after it has reached the 'Travel Limit' line. At this position, an upward-moving platform will stop ; however, a downward-moving platform will move continuously if a value of '1' is used and the platform is positioned below the 'Travel Limit' line. If the platform is placed above the 'Travel Limit' line, it will automatically be moved to the 'Travel Limit' line (no matter which direction it is moving) when it becomes active. The 'Travel Limit' line is located 7.5 Blocks below the upper zone border.

This platform functions independently of scroll limits (therefore, the 'Travel Limit' ignores scroll limits).

sprite.name: Rising Tilt Controlled Girder
sprite.notes: This is a Girder platform that can be controlled to move it left and right by tilting the Wii Remote. It will rise up until solid ground blocks its path, or until it reaches the Rising Tilt Lift Controller.

dependency.notes: The [281] Rising Tilt Controlled Girder Controller is required to be placed in the Zone for this platform to function. The platform must be placed below the Controller.

checkbox.title: Place In Front Of Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-Order of the platform placing it in front of other sprites.
checkbox.advancedcomment: Exact values are 80.0 unchecked, 450.0 checked.

checkbox.title: Loads at Midway
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the platform will only appear if the level has been loaded from a Midway point.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 10 (1)
checkbox.comment: Might affect the platform's direction properties.
checkbox.advancedcomment: ASM shows Nybble 10 might affect something.

list.title: Unknown Value 11
list.advancedcomment: ASM shows Nybble 11 might affect something.

sprite.name: Koopa Troopa
sprite.notes: Your standard Koopa Troopa. Place it in the level and it will walk towards Mario when it loads. It can either be set to walk off ledges, or turn around at ledges.

dualbox.comment: This determines if the Koopa Troopa will mindlessly walk off of ledges or if it will turn around when it reaches a ledge.
dualbox.comment2: This also changes the color of the Koopa Troopa.

list.title: Load State
list.comment: This determines what animation state the Koopa Troopa will load as.
list.comment2:
Normal: The Koopa Troopa will be walking normally when loaded.

Loads as Shell: The Koopa Troopa will load inside its shell and then return to normal.

Stays in Shell: The Koopa Troopa will load inside its shell and not return to normal. However, it cannot be kicked until jumped on and will instead hurt the player.

checkbox.title: Empty Shell
checkbox.comment: When enabled, a empty kickable shell is spawned instead of a Koopa Troopa.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Chainlink Fence
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Koopa Troopa will walk behind Chainlink Fences.
checkbox.advancedcomment: Exact values are 1500.0 unchecked, -2500.0 checked.

sprite.name: Koopa Paratroopa
sprite.notes: Your standard Koopa Paratroopa. Place it in the level and it will jump around or fly. Once stomped, it can either be set to walk off ledges, or turn around at ledges.

list.title: Movement Type
list.comment: This determines the primary type of movement behavior of the Koopa Paratroopa. Flying Paratroopas move 9 blocks total.
list.advancedcomment: Mode 3 spawns a floating shell that cannot be picked up. When Mario hits it from the side, he takes damage, but when the jumps on it, it falls to the ground and becomes a regular shell that can be picked up.

list.title: Start Direction
list.comment: This determines how the Paratroopa will move upon load.
list.advancedcomment: Glitchy Behavior: The Paratroopa will bounce [] while facing the opposite direction. Once de-winged, the Koopa Troopa will walk in place while continuing to face the same direction.

list.title: Start Direction
list.comment: This determines how the Paratroopa will move upon load.

dualbox.title1: Moves in specified direction (4 blocks), then turns around
dualbox.comment: This determines how far the Flying Paratroopa will move before first turning around. The Paratroopa will always have a path of 9 Blocks, so this only sets the initial movement distance on load.

dualbox.title1: Moves in specified direction (4 blocks), then turns around
dualbox.comment: This determines how far the Flying Paratroopa will move before first turning around. The Paratroopa will always have a path of 9 Blocks, so this only sets the initial movement distance on load.
This determines if the Koopa Troopa, once stepped on and de-winged, will mindlessly walk off of ledges or if it will turn around when it reaches a ledge.
dualbox.comment2: This also changes the color of the Koopa Troopa.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Chainlink Fence
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Koopa Paratroopa will be able to move behind Chainlink Fences.
checkbox.advancedcomment: Exact values are 1500.0 unchecked, -2500.0 checked.

value.title: Unknown Value 5
value.advancedcomment: Used in Retail: 06-01 A1 as 12

value.title: Unknown Flag 6 (8)
value.advancedcomment: Used in Retail: 06-01 A1

sprite.name: Line Controlled Tilt Controlled Girder
sprite.notes: A platform similar to the Tilt Controlled Girder that can navigate along Line guides.

checkbox.title: Loads at Midway
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the platform will only appear if the level has been loaded from a Midway point.

list.title: Activation Mode
list.comment: This determines when the platform will start moving.
list.entry: Will Move ONLY with All Players

value.title: Rendering Related
value.advancedcomment: Actually a pointless option. This option only affects the code that renders the sprite. Setting a value of 0 results in an automatic use of value 5. Furthermore, the value is automatically multiplied by 64. At 0 and 5, we get a value of 320. Treeki also thinks that this option could represent a counter. What this option actually does is control the blinking of the carrier platform. If the multiplied value is below 180 AND if the second bit of the nybble was used, the carrier platform will not be rendered. Otherwise, this option only has the ability to tweak the blinking of the carrier platform. One would have to play around with some values​​.

checkbox.title: No Rendering?
checkbox.advancedcomment: Selecting this option will trigger the effect described under [Rendering Related].

checkbox.title: Stays Off
checkbox.advancedcomment: Activating this will cause the platform to not react/move when a player stands on it. The code hints that it should only prevent this platform from disappearing instead of freezing it altogether.

value.title: Width of the Collision Box
value.advancedcomment: Value + 6. This option does not change the length of the platform, but instead the length of the (invisible) collision box attached. The collision box ensures that Mario does not fall through the platform. The collision box usually has the same size as the platform itself. The collision box and the platform have the same center point. Per value, the collision box will extend its length 1/2 blocks to the left and right. If you stand on this collision box but outside the platform, then it looks as if you are standing in midair.

sprite.name: Spike Top
sprite.notes: A Buzzy Beetle type enemy with a spike on top of it. It will follow and wrap around terrain and blocks.
sprite.advancednotes: Spike Tops don't properly work on slopes.

list.title: Orientation
list.comment: The Spike Top must be placed against something for it to appear.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the Spike Top will walk.

sprite.name: Big Boo
sprite.notes: A large version of the Boo enemy.

checkbox.title: Slightly Faster
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Big Boo will move slightly faster.

checkbox.title: Always Despawn
checkbox.comment: When disabled, the Big Boo will only despawn if it's off-screen and not moving. When enabled, it will despawn when it's off screen regardless of whether it's moving.

sprite.name: Spinning Fire Bar
sprite.notes: A Spinning Fire Bar like one you would find in a Castle stage.

dualbox.comment: This determines the size of the Block Base. The Fire Bar will emerge from the center of the base. The base also has no collision, so you will need to place Invisible Collision Blocks or other Tileset pieces behind it to create collision.

list.title: Length
list.comment: This determines how many fireballs make up one arm of the Fire Bar. One fireball adds approximately 0.75 blocks to the length.

checkbox.title: Double Fire Bar
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Fire Bar will extend from both ends of the Block Base.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the Fire Bar will rotate.
This determines how fast the Fire Bar will rotate.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Chainlink Fence
checkbox.comment: When enabled, any Chainlink Fence object will cover the Fire Bar, protecting the player from it unless they are also behind the fence. Exposed Fire Bars without fence in front of it will still hurt the player. The Block Base will also be hidden by Chainlink Fence.

sprite.name: Spiked Ball
sprite.notes: A loose Spiked Ball that will also destroy certain types of blocks.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the Spiked Ball will begin rolling in.

list.title: Speed
list.comment: This determines how fast the Spiked Ball rolls.

list.title: Speed After Hitting Wall
list.comment: This determines if the Spiked Ball will slow down after hitting a wall.

sprite.name: Effect - Thick Fog
sprite.notes:
This adds a thick rolling fog effect to the level that can be used with or without a Location ID.
The fog will make Non-location Lava/Poisoned Water function just like Water if it is added into the level after the liquids. You can avoid this by adding the fog and then re-adding the Lava/Poisoned Water, or by placing the liquids in their own separate locations.

value.title: Location ID
value.comment: This determines the location in which the Thick Fog will spawn.

sprite.name: Pipe Piranha Plant - Up
sprite.notes: A standard Piranha Plant that will appear from a pipe when placed adjacent to one.

checkbox.title: Immune to Fireballs
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Piranha Plant cannot be damaged by Fireballs. Ice balls will still freeze it.

sprite.name: Pipe Piranha Plant - Down
sprite.notes: A standard Piranha Plant that will appear from a pipe when placed adjacent to one.

checkbox.title: Immune to Fireballs
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Piranha Plant cannot be damaged by Fireballs. Ice balls will still freeze it.

sprite.name: Pipe Piranha Plant - Right
sprite.notes: A standard Piranha Plant that will appear from a pipe when placed adjacent to one. When placing this Piranha Plant underwater, it must be placed one block away from the pipe's edge.

checkbox.title: Immune to Fireballs
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Piranha Plant cannot be damaged by Fireballs. Ice balls will still freeze it.

checkbox.title: Immune to Fireballs
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Piranha Plant cannot be damaged by Fireballs. Ice balls will still freeze it.

sprite.name: Piranha Plant
sprite.notes: The standard Piranha Plant. It is affected by gravity.

checkbox.title: Upside-Down
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Piranha Plant will hang from the ceiling.
checkbox.comment2: It isn't affected by gravity when upside-down.

checkbox.title: Shift Half-Tile when Falling
checkbox.comment: When the Piranha Plant falls, it will shift over half a tile to the left.
checkbox.comment2: Used in Retail: 5-04 A1

sprite.name: Big Piranha Plant
sprite.notes: A large version of the standard Piranha Plant that takes 3 fireballs to kill. It is affected by gravity.

checkbox.title: Upside-Down
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Piranha Plant will hang from the ceiling.

checkbox.title: Shift Half-Tile when Falling
checkbox.comment: When the Piranha Plant falls, it will shift over half a tile to the left.
checkbox.comment2: Used in Retail: 5-04 A1

sprite.name: Fire Piranha Plant
sprite.notes: The Piranha Plant that shoots fireballs.

checkbox.title: Upside-Down
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Piranha Plant will hang from the ceiling.

sprite.name: Big Fire Piranha Plant
sprite.notes: A large version of the Piranha Plant that shoots fireballs. It takes 3 fireballs to kill.

checkbox.title: Upside-Down
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Piranha Plant will hang from the ceiling.

sprite.name: (Unused) Airship Key
sprite.notes: Flies up past the top-left corner of the screen when collected, but has no other purpose.

sprite.name: Bouncy Cloud
sprite.notes: A cloud platform with a happy face that the player can bounce on to jump really high.

checkbox.title: Larger Cloud
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Bouncy Cloud will be bigger.

sprite.name: Incomplete Sprite - 'En_Helpos'
sprite.notes: Does nothing.

sprite.name: Fire Bro
sprite.notes: A standard Brothers enemy that shoots fireballs at the player.

sprite.name: Grey Tiled Block with Spikes - Left
sprite.notes: This is a resizable stone block that was not used in retail NSMBW. Be aware that you cannot synchronize this block for level-wide timing purposes.

list.title: Height
list.comment: This determines how tall the block is.

list.title: Width
list.comment: This determines how wide the block is.

list.title: Movement Direction
list.comment: This determines the initial direction the block will travel.

checkbox.title: Offset Delay
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the block will wait two game seconds before moving the first time. This is important for adjusting timing in athletic levels.

value.title: Delay Before Movement
value.comment: This determines how long the block will wait before making its outwards movement.
value.comment2: Each value is equal to two game seconds.

value.title: Distance
value.comment: This defines how many tiles the block will move before returning to its starting position.

value.title: Delay Before Return
value.comment: This determines how long the block will wait before making its return movement.
value.comment2: Each value is equal to two game seconds.

list.title: Speed
list.comment: This determines the speed of the block's movement.

checkbox.title: Event Activated
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the block will only appear if the Triggering Event ID is activated.
checkbox.comment2: Note: The block will not disappear when the event is deactivated for as long as it remains loaded on screen. The player must place enough distance between them and the block's spawning location for it to despawn.

sprite.name: (Unused) Trampoline Wall
sprite.notes:
This sprite lacks finished textures and as such, is incomplete. Upon contact, the player is thrust in the opposite direction.

This sprite is not recommended for normal use at this time.

list.title: Height
list.comment: This determines how tall the Trampoline Wall is.

sprite.name: Incomplete Sprite - 'En_Boyon'
sprite.notes: Does nothing.

sprite.name: Incomplete Sprite - 'En_Remocon_Torimochi'
sprite.notes: Does nothing.

sprite.name: Effect - Wind Physics and Sound
sprite.notes: This will generate occasional windy pushbacks and wind sound effects. It is best used in conjunction with the suggested sprites, but they are not required.

dependency.notes: In order to generate sandstorm graphics, [374] Effect - Falling Objects and Wind is required using the Snow setting. To add coins to this effect, [284] Physics Coin Controller must be linked.

list.title: Force of Wind
list.comment: This determines how strongly the wind will blow.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the wind will blow.

value.title: Time Active
value.comment: This sets the amount of time that the wind is on.

value.title: Time Inactive
value.comment: This sets the amount of time that the wind is off.

value.title: Physics ID
value.comment: This will pair the Wind Physics with Physics Coin Controller.

sprite.name: Auto-Scrolling Controller
sprite.notes:
The Auto-Scroller will lock the game's camera along a specific Path. This path cannot cause the camera to unnaturally leave the Zone's boundaries. The camera's boundary is defined by the left side of the screen, so it is recommended to leave at least one screen's width after the path's final Node.

Finally, you can alter the Speed and Acceleration of the Auto-Scroller with the Path settings.

dependency.notes: A path is required for the Auto-Scrolling Controller to function.

list.title: Activation Mode
list.comment: This determines the conditions to activate the Auto-Scroller.
list.comment2:
Event Activated: Auto-Scroller only starts when the Triggering Event is activated. End Behaviors only work with this setting.

Behaves Incorrectly: Do not use this option.

Activated by Ground-Pounding [321]: When the Beta Arrow Block is ground-pounded, it sends code to the Auto-Scroller to start. Intended functionality was likely to control the direction as well.

Already Activated (Buggy): Activates without the need to set a Triggering Event. However, the camera tends to center the players on the screen whenever they get hit or an item.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When this Event ID is activated, the Auto-Scroller will activate. Deactivating the event will not deactivate the Auto-Scroller; it will continue until it has reached the final Path Node.

list.title: End Behavior
list.comment: This determines what the Auto-Scroller will do with the camera when it has reached the final Node of its path.
list.comment2:
Release Control and Activate Event: The camera will unlock, activate the Target Event ID, and the player can continue wherever they want. The camera may jerk slightly when it first releases.

Loop Last 2 Nodes: The Auto-Scroller will continue to scroll between the last two Nodes on the path.

Lock Screen: This option will lock the screen at the final path Node.

Unknown Value 2/3: May have different effects, ASM research is likely required.

list.title: End Behavior: Add Screen Shake
list.comment: As an additional effect to looping the last 2 nodes, you can add a rocking motion to the screen.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: When the Auto-Scroller reaches its final path Node, this Event ID is activated.

value.title: Path ID
value.comment: This determines which Path the camera will follow while scrolling. [CLARIFY] The upper left corner of the Screen, relative to the Auto-Scroller's placement, is the starting point for the path.

value.title: Midway Start Node ID
value.comment: If the level was entered from the Midway Point, the Auto-Scroller will begin from this Node instead of the first Node in the Path.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 10 (1)
checkbox.comment: Used in Retail 08-07; might be related to (unused) Path and Spine Coaster in A1Z1 and A2Z1.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 11 (1)
checkbox.comment: Possibly determines behavior relating to [159]. ASM shows Nybble 11 might affect something.

list.title: Camera Influence
list.comment: This determines how the Bullet Bills move relative to the camera.

value.title: Z-Order
value.comment: This will adjust the Z-Order of the Bullet Bills in relation to other Launchers. For usage examples, see Retail: 07-04 A1 Z5.

value.title: Homing Bullet Bill Limit
value.comment: The Blaster will not create new Homing Bullet Bills unless the amount currently on the screen is less than this number. Value 0 functions the same as Value 1.

list.title: Camera Influence
list.comment: This determines how the Banzai Bills move relative to the camera.

checkbox.title: (Broken) Shoots Homing Banzai Bills
checkbox.comment: The Banzai Bills do not home on the player but instead only move up and left, regardless of the shooting direction. Use the Homing Banzai Bill Spawner sprite instead.

value.title: Homing Banzai Bill Limit
value.comment: The Blaster will not create new Homing Banzai Bills unless the amount currently on the screen is less than this number.

value.title: Z-Order
value.comment: This will adjust the Z-Order of the Bullet Bills in relation to other Launchers. For usage examples, see Retail: 07-04 A1 Z5.

list.title: Unknown Value 9
list.comment: ASM shows Nybble 8 might affect something.

value.title: Unknown Value 11
value.comment: ASM shows Nybble 11 might affect something.

sprite.name: Boomerang Bro
sprite.notes: A standard Brothers enemy that throws Boomerangs at the player.

sprite.name: Hammer Bro Plus
sprite.notes: A standard Brothers enemy that throws hammers at the player.

dependency.notes: The Hammer Bro will first calculate where the nearest solid ground is. This is defined as a terrain object with solid block collision. With a platform limit of one, he can jump onto any passthrough terrain or brick blocks above this solid ground at a distance of 4. With a platform limit of two, he can jump between this platform and another one above it. When on the top of this platform limit, he will not try and jump upwards. He can also jump down from passthrough terrain set higher than 8 blocks above the solid ground, though he will not be able to return.

dualbox.comment: This determines the number of Platforms the AI of the Hammer Bro tries to make use of. See Dependency Notes for more information.

sprite.name: Rotation Controller - Swaying
sprite.notes: This controller will create synchronized movement between matched sprites and cause them to sway back and forth.

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: This pairs matching rotation controlled objects to this controller.

list.title: Swing Arc
list.comment: This determines how wide the swinging arc is.
list.comment2: Each value adds 11.25 degrees in each direction per value.

list.title: Speed
list.comment: This determines how quickly each direction of the swing completes. The greater the Swing Arc, the faster the relative rotation speed.
list.comment2: For example, a 270° arc will appear much faster than a 45° arc set with the same speed setting, but both will complete their Swing Arc at the same time.

value.title: Delay at Extremes
value.comment: This determines how long the Swing Arc will wait at the extremes of its angle.

checkbox.title: Reverse
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the timing of the left and right positions of the Swing Arc will be reversed in relation to other Swaying Controllers with the same settings.

list.title: Unknown Value 10
list.advancedcomment: 1: Used in Retail: 07-21 A2, 2: Used in Retail: 04-21 A1/A2/A3, 07-21 A1/A2/A4

sprite.name: (Unused) Rotation Controlled Block
sprite.notes: This is a block platform that is able to be controlled by a Rotation Controller. It is incomplete, so you may encounter issues when using it.
sprite.advancednotes: The class name is 'En_Lift_Rotation_Full' if you want to change the texture.

list.title: Z-Order
list.comment: This this changes the relative Z-Order of the block platform.

value.title: Width
value.comment: This determines the width of the block. It must be set to at least one.

value.title: Height
value.comment: This determines the height of the block. It must be set to at least one.

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: Match this sprite with a Rotation Controller to make this sprite move. Works with both Spinning and Swaying.

sprite.name: Giant Spiked Ball
sprite.notes: A large loose Spiked Ball that will also destroy certain types of blocks.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the Spiked Ball will begin rolling in.

list.title: Speed
list.comment: This determines how fast the Spiked Ball rolls.

list.title: Speed After Hitting Wall
list.comment: This determines if the Spiked Ball will slow down after hitting a wall.

sprite.name: Pipe Enemy Spawner
sprite.notes: The spawner must be placed on layer 1 tiles set to the core type 'Pipe'.

sprite.name: Swoop
sprite.notes: A basic cave bat that drops down from the ceiling and flies towards the player.

dependency.notes: The Swoop must be placed with terrain directly above it in order to spawn. A Swoop will activate when approached within 4 blocks horizontally, and from below at any distance.

checkbox.title: Leader
checkbox.comment: When enabled and paired with a colony, the Leader Swoop will activate all Swoops with the same Colony ID when approached by a player.
checkbox.comment2: If this is set, all non-Leaders will activate only if the Leader does. when the Leader is present.

value.title: Colony ID
value.comment: This determines what colony a Leader will trigger.
value.comment2: If no Leader is present, Swoops with a Colony ID will activate only within ~1 block horizontally, instead of 4 blocks.

sprite.name: Bob-Omb
sprite.notes: A standard Bob-Omb enemy. It will spawn walking towards the player and will fall off of ledges. When stepped on or struck with a fireball, it will eventually explode damaging certain types of blocks, terrain, and enemies.

list.title: Load-In Animation
list.comment: This determines what animation state is used by the Bob-Omb when it is first loaded. This is used by the sprite indicated, so refer to them for more information.
list.comment2:
Frozen in Ice (Minus Ice): The Bob-Omb is static and lacks collision.
Pipe Spawn: The spawn-in animation is in front of Layer 1.

sprite.name: Broozer
sprite.notes: A ghost house enemy that charges towards the Player when they're nearby. He must be stepped on thrice in order to be defeated. He will also destroy certain types of blocks and terrain with his flailing attack. Please note that he can only destroy tileset bricks and not sprite bricks.

sprite.name: Basic Platform - Spawner
sprite.notes: This sprite will continuously spawn platforms moving in a specific direction. By default, spawned platforms will disappear when the Spawner sprite is off-screen.

checkbox.title: Platforms Don't Despawn
checkbox.comment: When enabled, on-screen platforms will not despawn once the Spawner sprite itself is off-screen.

checkbox.title: Remain Active Off-Screen*
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Spawner will continue to spawn platforms off-screen as long as it was loaded on-screen prior. Otherwise, spawned platforms and the Spawner itself will all unload whenever the Spawner sprite is off-screen.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: The flag of the Spawner will change if the direction is horizontal or vertical.

checkbox.title: Don't Spawn with 4 Platforms
checkbox.comment: Leaving this off will have the sprite spawn with 4 platforms pre-loaded.

sprite.name: Amp
sprite.yoshinotes: Yoshi will be damaged by this enemy, but Yoshi cannot eat it. The player will not get electrocuted if riding Yoshi.
sprite.notes:
A stationary floating enemy that will electrocute the player when they touch it.
Be aware that if Mario is hit by an Amp underwater, the animation will be interrupted and Mario will take no damage.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-Order of the Amp placing it further behind other sprites.

sprite.name: Pokey
sprite.notes: A tall segmented enemy whose pieces must be destroyed individually unless the head is defeated first.

list.title: Height
list.comment: This determines how tall the Pokey is. One piece will be the head, and every other piece is a body piece.
list.comment2: The height value also affects what Yoshi lays when consumed whole.

dualbox.comment: This determines the color of the platform.

value.title: Width
value.comment: This determines the width of the platform.
value.comment2: This value needs to be 2 or greater.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the platform will move based on the Line that it is connected to.

checkbox.title: Starts Moving on Touch
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the platform will be stationary until touched by a player.

list.title: Speed
list.comment: Line Controlled sprites use the same speed setting across all of them.

value.title: Z-Order
value.comment: This will adjust the Z-Order of the platforms in relation to other objects.
value.comment2: A higher value will place this sprite further towards the background.

checkbox.title: Event Activated
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the platform will only appear if the Triggering Event ID is activated.

sprite.name: (Unused) Rotation Controlled Solid Platform
sprite.notes: "En_Lift_Rotation_Half". A Rotation Controlled block that works quite well. Flag x08 + x02 (x0A) (Unique Flag).

list.title: Width
list.comment: This determines the width of the platform in blocks.

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: Works with both Swaying and Spinning.

sprite.name: Line Controlled Amp Spawner
sprite.yoshinotes: Yoshi will be damaged by this enemy, but Yoshi cannot eat it. The player will not get electrocuted if riding Yoshi.
sprite.notes:
This will spawn a specified number of Amps along the Line that the sprite is placed on. Once it has spawned the number of Amps it is set to, it will not do anything else even if they fall off.

Be aware that if Mario is hit by an Amp underwater, the animation will be interrupted and Mario will take no damage.

dependency.notes: Place this sprite directly onto the Line guide that you want it to spawn on.

list.title: Number of Amps
list.comment: This determines how many Amps are spawned on the Line by this Spawner.

value.title: Delay Between Amp Spawns
value.comment: This determines how long the game will wait between each Amp is spawned, increasing the distance between each Amp.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the Amps will move based on the Line that they are connected to.

list.title: Speed
list.comment: Line Controlled sprites use the same speed setting across all of them.

value.title: Z-Order
value.comment: This will adjust the Z-Order of the Amps in relation to other objects.
value.comment2: A higher value will place this sprite further towards the background.

sprite.name: Spiked Ball on a Chain
sprite.notes: This is a Spiked Ball attached to a chain that rotates on its own.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the Spiked Ball will rotate.

list.title: Start Direction
list.comment: This determines which direction the Spiked Ball will appear from the center of the rotation point when it first loads.

sprite.name: Effect - Sunbeam
sprite.notes: This will generate a bright Sunbeam effect from the top right of the camera. Note that despawning this sprite does not remove the effect.

dependency.notes: If this sprite is placed more than once in the same Zone, the game will crash. The placement of this sprite does not change its effects.

list.title: Type
list.advancedcomment: The ASM implies that this nybble was once used to select the type of effect. However, there is no code for any type that is not "Sunbeam" in the final game, so setting this to any other value will make this sprite do nothing. Interestingly, it does not delete itself, so it continues to use some memory.

sprite.name: Blooper
sprite.notes: An underwater enemy that will chase the player.

dependency.notes: Because the Bloopers can be used without Water, if they are placed in anything but an Underwater style level, they will appear to fly rather than swim and not be confined to Location Water, etc.

list.title: Hiding In Wait
list.comment: When this is set to an option other than the default, the Blooper will wait for the player to approach before shooting out from behind the terrain.

sprite.name: Blooper Nanny with Babies
sprite.notes: An underwater enemy that will chase the player with a trail of babies in tow.

dependency.notes: Because the Bloopers can be used without Water, if they are placed in anything but an Underwater style level, they will appear to fly rather than swim and not be confined to Location Water, etc.

list.title: Hiding In Wait
list.comment: When this is set to an option other than the default, the Blooper will wait for the player to approach before shooting out from behind the terrain.

sprite.name: Goal Pole and Fortress
sprite.notes: The invisible wall does not extend below the Goal Pole.

sprite.name: Burner - Continuous
sprite.notes: A standard flame jet that's always on.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: This determines which direction the flame jet is pointing.

sprite.name: Cheep Cheep / Deep Cheep / Eep Cheep
sprite.notes: A basic Cheep Cheep and its very similar brethren. When placed in water, it will swim along or even swim after the player.

dependency.notes: The Cheep Cheep will only spawn if placed within water. In addition, Deep Cheeps and the Eep Cheep only work on non-location water.

checkbox.title: Swims Left
checkbox.comment: If checked, swims to the left. The fish will not swim backwards when you backtrack. If unchecked, the direction the Cheep Cheep swims first depends on the 'Type'. For Types 3, 4, 6 and 7, it swims to the right in general. All other types will cause the Cheep Cheeps to swim first in Mario's direction.

list.title: Type
list.comment: This determines which type of behavior the Cheep Cheep will follow, as well as the type of Cheep Cheep that is spawned.
list.comment2:
Specifies the Swimming-'Type' that should be used for this Cheep Cheep. Value 5 is unique. Type-5 Cheep Cheeps will look into the camera until Mario comes close. Furthermore, the direction will be ignored and the Cheep Cheep will always swim in the opposite direction, away from Mario, if Mario is close enough.

Values marked ​​with an asterisk (*) will ignore the speed value set and instead will always use value 1, no matter what is selected there. Also, all values ​​with (*) will let the Cheep Cheep swim in a wavy line (just as the Coin Cheep Cheep does).

The two values ​​with (**) follow exactly the same behavior as those marked with (*), the only difference is its speed. Cheep Cheeps affected will swim slightly faster, both vertical and horizontal.
list.entry: Cheep Cheep ("WaterWait"), Waits, Then Swims Straight**

list.title: Swim Speed
list.comment: This determines the swimming speed of [?????] Types of Cheep Cheep.
list.comment2: Note: Type-3 Cheep Cheeps (Swims Left / Right) have the same speed as values 1 and 2. [Both? What? Slow and Medium-Slow?]

list.title: Swim Distance
list.comment: This determines the distance that a Type 3 Cheep Cheep will swim in both directions from its initial placement.

checkbox.title: Positioning Flag (2)
checkbox.comment:
Treeki:
Setting Flag 2 and 4 for Nybble 4: This function will create a particular Y position picture of all the Cheep Cheeps, each frame. The 'Cheep Cheep Formation Spawner' that has generated the Cheep Cheeps will store this 'picture'.

checkbox.title: Positioning Flag (4)
checkbox.comment:
Treeki:
Setting Flag 2 and 4 for Nybble 4: This function will create a particular Y position picture of all the Cheep Cheeps, each frame. The 'Cheep Cheep Formation Spawner' that has generated the Cheep Cheeps will store this 'picture'.

value.title: Positioning
value.comment:
Treeki also commented:
'Nybble 6 determines WHICH position is allocated to the fish. This option is only useful for the Cheep Cheep Formation Spawner (247), because 247 uses this nybble for all generated Cheep Cheeps. For everything else, this option seems to be pointless. When you use the two flags for a Cheep Cheep in Reggie!, the corresponding Cheep Cheep won't have 'parents' any more, so it will get some random data for the Y position and might go off the screen. So you can safely ignore this value.'

value.title: 'Dodge' Triggering Event ID
value.comment:
This may look weird at first glance, but it seems as if this function should work. It definitely has to do with Type 3 (Swims Left / Right).
Treeki wrote this: 'LrSwim (Type 3) accepts an Event that will make the Cheep Cheep follow the player (turning state LrSwim into state LrSrcSwim)'. If it really works is a good question. Try it and report your findings!

sprite.name: (Unused) Coin Cheep
sprite.notes: <font color="red">This sprite is not recommended for use.</font> Just use a regular Cheep Cheep.
sprite.advancednotes: An incomplete Cheep Cheep that swims in a specific direction. It bobs up and down as it swims. It is supposed to be the Cheep Cheep from NSMB:DS that pulls coins along with it. This functionality may exist within the sprite, but require a specific coin, setting, or controller to accomplish it.

dependency.notes: The Coin Cheep can be placed in both non-location water and location water.

checkbox.title: Waiting
checkbox.comment: When enabled, if the player is not within ~5 blocks, the Coin Cheep will sit facing the camera. When the player gets within range, it will activate and start swimming Left. This direction overrides the swimming direction.

dualbox.comment: This determines the direction the Coin Cheep will swim when loaded. It does not have a Towards Player option.

list.title: Speed
list.comment: This determines the speed that the Coin Cheep swims at.

sprite.name: Burner - Pulsating
sprite.notes: A standard flame jet that switches between off and on every 3 ticks of the game's clock.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: This determines which direction the flame jet is pointing.

sprite.name: Dry Bones
sprite.notes: A skeletal Koopa Troopa that cannot die from being stomped on. It will also not walk off of platforms.

checkbox.title: Immune to Lava
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Dry Bones will not 'disappear' when he touches lava.

sprite.name: Giant Dry Bones
sprite.notes: A large version of the Dry Bones enemy that must be ground-pounded in order to be rendered unconscious.

sprite.name: Sledge Bro
sprite.notes: A large bulky version of the Hammer Brothers enemy that will stomp the ground, stunning players touching the ground, in addition to throwing large hammers.

sprite.name: (Crashes) Collision Switcher
sprite.notes: This controller will switch the active collision layer from Layer 1 to Layer 2 and back when the Player holds up at the sprite's placement. <font color="red">This sprite will crash the game without the required texture file "Sample/tobira.bti" </font> Adding this texture allows the sprite to function. Note that the texture's dimensions don't affect the 1 block wide collision for switching Layers.

sprite.name: Basic Platform - One-Way
sprite.notes: This platform moves in the specified direction when all players are standing on it.

list.title: Model
list.comment: This will set the color of the platform. Higher values are the same as 0.
list.advancedcomment: Instead of the normal model, a texture from boss_koopa_lift.arc can be used. Replacing this model will result in custom textures for the platform.

list.title: Width
list.comment: This determines the width of the platform.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: This determines which direction the platform will move. Values higher than 4 behave the same as 4.
