list.comment: This determines the number of frames between consecutive bombs that are spawned in the same wave. Every wave consists of 3 Bob-ombs that are spawned at a random x coordinate in the right 3/4ths of the screen. There are 360 frames between consecutive waves.

sprite.name: Scaredy Rat
sprite.notes: A small relatively harmless rodent that will walk across the stage and fall off platform edges. When in a swarm, if one rat is stepped on, the others will quickly run away from the spot the first one was stomped. If they encounter another rat, they will join together in a larger swarm and stop running. If they encounter a [451] Scaredy Rat Despawner, they will despawn.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: This determines what the initial movement direction of the rat is.
list.comment2: Values higher than 3 give the same behaviour as 3.

list.title: Number in Swarm
list.comment: This determines how many rats form the swarm.
list.comment2: Don't worry too much about vertical placement. They manage to find a proper home based on the placement of the first rat.

sprite.name: Ice Bro
sprite.notes: A standard Brothers enemy that shoots ice balls at the player.

sprite.name: Unused
sprite.notes: No assigned function, does nothing in-game.

sprite.name: Rotation Controlled Metal Castle Gear
sprite.notes: A metallic rotating gear object with either 4 or 8 teeth. It can crush the player with an instant-kill if they get trapped between terrain or other solid objects from the rotation.

dependency.notes:
The Castle Gear can either rotate on its own power, or can be set to rotate with a rotation controller. It can also be paired with a Swaying controller if you want to be silly.
Finally, the cogs on the center and teeth all draw in front of Layer 1, but everything else draws behind it.

list.title: Size
list.comment: This determines how large the gear is.
list.comment2: Values larger than 1 crash the game.

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: When set, the gear will move under the power of a rotation controller instead of rotating under its own power.
value.comment2: The gear will rotate in place, regardless of the rotation controller's position.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the gear will rotate when rotating under its own power.

value.title: Rotation Speed (+)
value.comment: This will increase the speed of the gear's rotation when rotating under its own power.
value.comment2: Only one Rotation Speed should be chosen. A rotation speed of 0 is equal to 'Slow+' on a Spinning rotation controller.

value.title: Rotation Speed (-)
value.comment: This will decrease the speed of the gear's rotation when rotating under its own power.
value.comment2: Only one Rotation Speed should be chosen. A rotation speed of 0 is equal to 'Slow+' on a Spinning rotation controller.

sprite.name: 5-Enemy-Max Raft
sprite.notes: A large raft that counts from 0 to 5 for each enemy that is riding on top of it, and will stop when it reaches 5. While the value it stops at can be changed, its visuals are hard-coded.

dependency.notes: The raft can function without any form of liquid, as it does not snap to the top of Water or other liquids. However, aesthetically, it is recommended to utilize one of the liquids. Moving Water modes and other similar sprites will not interact with the raft.

checkbox.title: Moves Faster
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the raft will move twice as fast as normal.
checkbox.comment2: The raft will normally move about 10 blocks in 7 game seconds.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the raft will move in when it is actively moving.
dualbox.advancedcomment: Values 2 and 3 both cause the raft to not move. May have an alternate use but unlikely.

checkbox.title: Starts Moving on Touch
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Platform will start moving when any player touches it. Otherwise, it will begin moving when loaded.

list.title: Amount of Sprites to Stop
list.comment: This determines the number of enemies and other non-player sprites needed to cause the raft to stop moving.
list.comment2: This will not change the visible functions of the displayed counter.

value.title: Unknown Value 12
value.advancedcomment: May have been intended to be width related but does not seem to do anything. (Retail platform is 24 blocks wide, 3 blocks per segment with 8 segments.)

sprite.name: Ghost House Door
sprite.notes: A Ghost House door that can have an Entrance placed on it.
sprite.advancednotes: The door can also be paired with a Rotation Controller, but the results are moderately glitchy with many combinations not functioning and several restrictions on getting them to work as actual doors.

checkbox.title: Fake Door
checkbox.comment: When enabled, when the player attempt to enter the door, it will vanish and disperse into 4 harmless Boos.

list.title: Orientation
list.comment: This determines which direction the door will be facing.
list.comment2: A door can only be entered if it is upright.
list.advancedcomment: As decoration, this is fine. Actually making it properly associate its corresponding Entrance is either impossible or very functionally strange.

checkbox.title: Rotation Controlled (Buggy)
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the door will only function when paired with a Rotation ID.
checkbox.advancedcomment: 'Function' is perhaps misleading. There are only a few ways you can successfully utilize a Rotation Controller door. For starters, you can only enter the door while it is almost fully upright. There is also a peculiarity with how the Entrance is placed. The most reliable way to use a Rotation Controlled Door is to place it with an already activated Spinning controller that returns to its original position when deactivated.

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: This pairs the Door to a matching rotation controller.

sprite.name: Tower Boss Door
sprite.notes: A large red door that can have an Entrance placed on it.
sprite.advancednotes: The door can also be paired with a Rotation Controller, but the results are moderately glitchy with many combinations not functioning and several restrictions on getting them to work as actual doors.

list.title: Orientation
list.comment: This determines which direction the door will be facing.
list.comment2: A door can only be entered if it is upright.
list.advancedcomment: As decoration, this is fine. Actually making it properly associate its corresponding Entrance is either impossible or very functionally strange.

checkbox.title: Rotation Controlled (Buggy)
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the door will only function when paired with a Rotation ID.
checkbox.advancedcomment: 'Function' is perhaps misleading. There are only a few ways you can successfully utilize a Rotation Controller door. For starters, you can only enter the door while it is almost fully upright. There is also a peculiarity with how the Entrance is placed. The most reliable way to use a Rotation Controlled Door is to place it with an already activated Spinning controller that returns to its original position when deactivated.

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: This pairs the Door to a matching rotation controller.

sprite.name: Castle Boss Door
sprite.notes: A large blue door that can have an Entrance placed on it.
sprite.advancednotes: The door can also be paired with a Rotation Controller, but the results are moderately glitchy with many combinations not functioning and several restrictions on getting them to work as actual doors.

list.title: Orientation
list.comment: This determines which direction the door will be facing.
list.comment2: A door can only be entered if it is upright.
list.advancedcomment: As decoration, this is fine. Actually making it properly associate its corresponding Entrance is either impossible or very functionally strange.

checkbox.title: Rotation Controlled (Buggy)
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the door will only function when paired with a Rotation ID.
checkbox.advancedcomment: 'Function' is perhaps misleading. There are only a few ways you can successfully utilize a Rotation Controller door. For starters, you can only enter the door while it is almost fully upright. There is also a peculiarity with how the Entrance is placed. The most reliable way to use a Rotation Controlled Door is to place it with an already activated Spinning controller that returns to its original position when deactivated.

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: This pairs the Door to a matching rotation controller.

sprite.name: Incomplete Sprite - 'Ac_Lift_Ice_Spring'
sprite.notes: Does nothing.

sprite.name: Giant Ice Block
sprite.notes: A large 3x3 ice block that can be broken with an explosion.

list.title: Frozen Inside
list.comment: This determines what type of object is frozen inside the block.
list.comment2: Bob-Omb ice blocks will explode to other nearby ice blocks.

sprite.name: Rising Tilt Controlled Girder Controller
sprite.notes: A controller for the Rising Tilt Controlled Girder that will place a limit on the vertical ascent of the platform.

dependency.notes: The controller must be placed above a [56] Rising Tilt Controlled Girder. The placement of this controller will determine the stopping point of the rising girder's vertical ascent.

sprite.name: Incomplete Sprite - 'En_WallInsect'
sprite.notes: Does nothing.

sprite.name: Incomplete Sprite - 'WallInsect_Mgr'
sprite.notes: Does nothing.

sprite.name: Physics Coin Controller
sprite.notes: A coin related controller that currently is only known to be paired with [90] Wind Physics. It may have other functions, or it may have had all secondary functions scrapped during development.

dependency.notes: Can add coins to the [90] Wind Physics and Sound effect.

list.title: Type
list.comment: This determines which movement type will be used.

value.title: Physics ID
value.comment: This will pair the Physics Coin Controller with the matching Wind Physics.

value.title: Location ID
value.advancedcomment: Can somehow use Location ID, but unknown how it functions.

value.title: Unknown Value 8
value.advancedcomment: Used in Retail: 02-04 A1, as 1.

sprite.name: Rising/Falling Water
sprite.notes: Unlike normal [138] Water, Rising/Falling Water contains many functions of Moving Water in a stand-alone form. Similar compatibility issues still exist, and in particular it should be noted that this functions by moving a fixed depth 'block' of water up and down.

dependency.notes: The bottom edge of the water can be exposed if the Depth value is not large enough. Additionally, the player can fall out from the bottom edge of the water unless there is approximately 4 blocks of water under the bottom edge of the screen. Outside of that restriction, all setting combinations with this sprite function just fine.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When set, the Water will only move when the Triggering Event is activated. Otherwise, the Water will move automatically.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the Water will move first when activated.

list.title: Speed
list.comment: This determines how quickly the water moves up and down.

value.title: Delay at Top
value.comment: This determines the delay when the Water has finished rising.

value.title: Delay at Bottom
value.comment: This determines the delay when the Water has finished falling.

list.title: Movement Distance
list.comment: This determines how far the Water will move.

list.title: Depth of Water
list.comment: This determines how deep the Water is, counting the wavy crest on the top.
list.comment2: If the water is not set deep enough, the players will be able to see 'air' at the bottom, or they can potentially fall out of the Water completely.

sprite.name: Rotating Wooden Airship Wheel
sprite.notes: A circular wheel matching the standard airship decor that rotates, making it hard to stand on.

list.title: Size
list.comment: This determines the size of the wheel.

dualbox.comment: This determines the direction the wheel will rotate in.

value.title: Speed
value.comment: This determines the speed of the wheel's rotation. A speed of 0 still moves, just very slowly.

sprite.name: (Unused) Path Controlled Ice Block
sprite.notes: A slippery block of ice that can be paired with a Path.

dependency.notes: A Use Paths Movement Controller is required to make use of this ice block. Also, using the larger sizes is not recommended unless using sizehacks with other sprites.

value.title: Height
value.comment: This determines the height of the ice block.
value.comment2: Large values will very likely look ugly alongside other level content.

value.title: Width
value.comment: This determines the width of the ice block.
value.comment2: Large values will very likely look ugly alongside other level content.

value.title: Path Movement ID
value.comment: Match the Path Movement ID with Sprite 159 in order to use this ice block.

value.title: Starting Node
value.comment: This determines which Node along the Path the ice block will start on.

list.title: At the End...
list.comment: This determines what the behavior of the ice block will be when it reaches the final Node of the Path it is travelling.

value.title: "Jump to" Node
value.comment: This determines which Node along the Path the test platform will return to after reaching the end of the Path.

list.title: Intial Rolling Direction
list.comment2: Value 3 is the same as value 0.

sprite.name: Wooden/Metal Box
sprite.notes: Wooden boxes can be opened if Ground-Pounded, struck from below, etc. and can award the player with an item. Metal boxes can instantly kill the player, cannot be destroyed, and make a POW sound when falling. They also have odd issues when it comes to respawning if they have moved from their original location.

value.title: Z-Order
value.comment: Changes the Z-Order of the box. See the 2nd comment for a list of values.
value.comment2: Observed effects:[br]* Value 0: On layer 1, behind layer 0[br]* Value 1: Behind layer 1, above layer 2[br]* Values 2-15: Above layer 1, below layer 0

sprite.name: Incomplete Sprite - 'En_Iwao'
sprite.notes: Does nothing.

sprite.name: Para-Beetle
sprite.notes: A small flying Buzzy Beetle type enemy that can be ridden on top of, but will still hurt the player if they contact one from the side or from below.

value.title: Speed
value.comment: Value 0 keeps it in place.

list.title: Facing
list.comment: Will fly backwards if facing wrong direction.

sprite.name: Heavy Para-Beetle
sprite.notes: A large flying Buzzy Beetle type enemy that can be ridden on top of, but will still hurt the player if they contact one from the side or from below.

value.title: Speed
value.comment: Value 0 keeps it in place.

list.title: Facing
list.comment: Will fly backwards if facing wrong direction.

sprite.name: Volcano Rock Spawn Area
sprite.notes: Assigns a spawn area where various sizes of Volcano Rocks will hurl down from the sky destroying certain types of terrain and blocks as well as attempting to hurt the player. However, a location is NOT required, and actually changes the fundamental effects of this sprite.

value.title: Location ID
value.comment: When set, large amounts of Volcano Rocks will spawn intermittently from the top of the screen only while the player is within this location. Additionally, if using the Volcano background, it will erupt prior to this wave of rocks.
value.comment2: When not set, the Volcano Rocks will still spawn, but they will spawn infrequently and one at a time for the entire zone. It will also not cause an eruption from the Volcano background.

sprite.name: Meltable Ice Cube
sprite.notes: A small, 'smoking', slippery ice cube that can be melted with Fireballs.

sprite.name: Airship Nut Platform
sprite.notes: A platform made up of 6 connected nuts that will spin and 'thread' itself left when jumped on, but also attempting to drop the player beneath it. It will stop advancing if it reaches a solid wall, and it will travel backwards if it has not been jumped on recently. It can despawn if the player leaves the screen with it.

dependency.notes: While not required, it is suggested to use some sort of terrain alongside this sprite, usually the 'wire' terrain object (#15) from the Airship decorations in Pa1 or some variant on it.

value.title: Offset Right
value.comment: This determines how far 'forward' the nut will be already spun. This affects the maximum return distance of the nut platform.

checkbox.title: Offset Down .5 Blocks
checkbox.advancedcomment: A holdover setting from development and not important.

sprite.name: Giant Buzzy Beetle
sprite.notes:
A very large Buzzy Beetle that isn't especially pretty, but will carry the player around on its back. It can still hurt the player from the side.
Giant Buzzys don't fall down if placed in the air. They will follow the ground and slopes if snapped to the ground. Finally, they will move in a straight line if they reach a 90° drop.

value.title: Speed
value.comment: When the speed is 0, the Beetle won't move. Very high values may make the Beetle not spawn.

list.title: Facing
list.comment: This also indicates the starting direction of the Beetle. Value 2+ starts walking left, but sometimes has difficulty turning at walls and ledges.

sprite.name: Spine Coaster
sprite.notes: A quick Line guided platform that will screech and clatter as it travels.

list.title: Length
list.comment: This determines how many platform segments make up the Spine Coaster.

value.title: Speed
value.comment: This determines how quickly the Spine Coaster will travel along the Lines.

checkbox.title: Touch Activated
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this platform will activate when all players are touching the Spine Coaster.
checkbox.comment2: When not enabled, this platform will only activate when a platform with the same Spine ID is activated through Touch Activation.

value.title: Coaster ID
value.comment: This will pair multiple Spine Coasters together so that when one of them starts, they all start at the same time.
value.comment2: Do not pair more than one Spine Coaster with [Touch Activated] enabled!

list.title: Camera Influence
list.comment: This determines how the cannonball moves relative to the camera.

dualbox.comment: This determines the size of the cannon and cannonball.
This determines which direction the cannon will face.

list.title: Normal Cannon Length
list.comment: This determines how long the cannon is.

list.title: Giant Cannon Length
list.comment: This determines how long the cannon is. If the cannon is giant, the collision will always be value + 3 blocks long, but the visual will not.

checkbox.title: Direction Override: Down, Causes Weird Bugs
checkbox.advancedcomment: Only the front of the cannon will be changed, and when also set to face left, causes weird influence on the cannonball's trajectory. Highly suggested to not use this setting.

sprite.name: 45° Cannon
sprite.notes: A cannon that will fire ammo in a 45° direction, and can fire either cannonballs or Bob-Ombs.

list.title: Ammo Type
list.comment: This determines what the cannon will fire. One cannon will only let out 8 Bob-ombs at a time.

list.title: Camera Influence
list.comment: This determines how the cannonball moves relative to the camera.

value.title: Bob-Omb Delay
value.comment: This determines how long the cannon will wait between each time it launches a Bob-Omb. This value is measured in game seconds.

checkbox.title: Upside-Down
checkbox.comment2: The cannon is able to shoot left, right, up and down by editing both nybble 11 and 12. However, the sprite was not intended to these settings. As a result, all unlisted settings do not work properly.

checkbox.title: Rotating Cannon
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the cannon will rotate in the opposite direction after each time it fires.

sprite.name: 4-Way Cannon
sprite.notes: A small 4-way rotating cannonball launcher.

list.title: Camera Influence
list.comment: This determines how the cannonball moves relative to the camera.

checkbox.title: Upside-Down
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the cannon is upside-down and can be placed against the ceiling.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the cannon will fire when it is first loaded.
This determines which direction the cannon will rotate.
dualbox.comment2: This is an aesthetic choice only, and it will not change the functionality of the cannon.

sprite.name: 4-Way Large Cannon with Pipe
sprite.notes: A large 4-way rotating cannonball launcher that has a pipe in place of one of the four cannons.

list.title: Camera Influence
list.comment: This determines how the cannonball moves relative to the camera.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the cannon and pipe will rotate.

list.title: Pipe Position at Load
list.comment: This determines the pipe's position when the cannon first loads on the screen.

value.title: Entrance ID
value.comment: This determines the Entrance ID that the pipe will connect with.
value.comment2: It does not have to be placed on the pipe. It can only be used as an exit.

checkbox.title: Upside-Down
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the cannon is upside-down and can be placed against the ceiling.
checkbox.advancedcomment: The pipe will load on the opposite side alongside a cannon, leaving a hole on one side. As such, this option should not be used.

sprite.name: Incomplete Sprite - 'En_Gake_Noko'
sprite.notes: Does nothing.

sprite.name: Monty Mole
sprite.notes: An energetic mole enemy that will pop out of the terrain after loading on screen and proceed to move quickly after the player. A Monty Hole is left behind after the mole jumps out.

checkbox.title: Loose Monty Mole
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Monty Mole will already be out of the wall running around, and does not leave behind a Monty Hole.

sprite.name: Burner - Rotating
sprite.notes: A standard flame jet that's always on and will rotate from one side to the other.

list.title: Flame Length
list.comment: This determines how long the flame is.

checkbox.title: Upside-Down
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the flame jet is upside-down and can be placed against the ceiling.

sprite.name: Lighting - Circle
sprite.notes: A small spot of light that only functions when the lighting mode is set to cause darkness.

dependency.notes: As with all Lighting involved sprites, the effect is severely diminished when not using Full Darkness. Additionally, this sprite only functions with very specific settings. First, it cannot be used unless it is matched to a movement controller. Second, Swaying cannot actually move it, which makes it best for stationary use. Other movement types are fully capable of moving the light circle around.

list.title: Activation Mode
list.comment: This determines if the light circle is naturally on, or if it is event controlled.

list.title: Movement Type
list.comment: ** - Pairing the light circle with a Swaying controller will not generate movement. However, as a movement controller is required for the light circle to spawn, using a Swaying controller is a great way to create a stationary spot of light.

value.title: Path Movement ID
value.comment: If pairing the light circle with Sprite 159, match the Path Movement ID to enable Path controlled movement.

value.title: Two Way Line ID
value.comment: If pairing the light circle with sprite 260, match the Two Way Line ID to enable Two Way synchronized movement.

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: If pairing the light circle with sprite 96 or 149, match the Rotation ID to allow the light circle to function.
value.comment2: Only pairing it with a Spinning controller will actually allow movement. Swaying controllers will create a stationary spot of light.

value.title: Triggering Event ID 1
value.comment: This determines which single Event must be activated for the circle to glow. If this one is set, the other Triggering Event ID will be completely ignored.

value.title: Triggering Event ID 2
value.comment: This setting can also determine the single Event ID that controls the circle's glow.

sprite.name: Lighting - Rotation Controlled Spotlight
sprite.notes: A hanging spotlight lamp with a decorative vertical support that generates a cone of light.

dependency.notes: When using the Spotlight with Path movement or Two Way Line movement, the light will remain in a fixed position and the entire structure will move along the Path / move back and forth. The Two Way Line movement cannot be Event Activated. When using the Spotlight with a Swaying rotation controller, the rotation controller must be placed directly on the swinging point of the Spotlight's hinge. If it is not, it behaves incorrectly. It must be paired to some form of movement controller in order to function.

list.title: Light's Angle
list.comment: This determines the angle of the Spotlight.
list.comment2: When paired with a Swaying rotation controller, the light will swing equally to both sides of this value. Other movement controllers will not change the light's angle.

list.title: Movement Type
list.comment: This determines the movement behavior of the Spotlight.

value.title: Path Movement ID
value.comment: If pairing the Spotlight with Sprite 159, match the Path Movement ID to enable Path controlled movement. It won't spawn without one.

value.title: Two Way Line ID
value.comment: If pairing the Spotlight with sprite 260, match the Two Way Line ID to enable Two Way synchronized movement. It won't spawn without one.

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: If pairing the Spotlight with sprite 96 or 149, match the Rotation ID to enable Swaying or Spinning movement. It won't spawn without one.
value.comment2: When using sprite 149, be sure to place the controller at the Spotlight's exact position. Otherwise, the entire sprite will rotate around the controller awkwardly.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 7 (1)
checkbox.advancedcomment: ASM shows Nybble 7 might affect something.

sprite.name: Burner - Pulsating (Synchronized) Controller
sprite.notes: A controller that allows creation of synchronized waves of pulsating flame jets.

dependency.notes: Synchronized flame jets will only function if associated with a matching controller.

value.title: Time Active (Mode 1)
value.comment: This determines how long the flame jet will stay active in Mode 1.
value.comment2: A value of 64 is equal to one game second.

value.title: Time Active (Mode 2)
value.comment: This determines how long the flame jet will stay active in Mode 2.
value.comment2: A value of 64 is equal to one game second.

list.title: Length
list.comment: This determines the length of the flame created by linked flame jets.

value.title: Burner ID
value.comment: This determines which flame jets are linked to this controller.

sprite.name: Platform Hammer Bro
sprite.notes: 'En_Lift_HammerBros' - Likely allows it to be used on places where he shouldn't jump off.

dualbox.comment: This determines the number of Platforms the AI of the Hammer Bro tries to make use of. See Dependency Notes for more information.

sprite.name: Burner - Pulsating (Synchronized)
sprite.notes: A pulsating flame jet that can be paired with a controller to allow for synchronized activation.

dependency.notes: Synchronized flame jets will only function if associated with a matching controller.

dualbox.comment: This determines which mode the flame jet will be activated during.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: This determines which direction the flame jet is pointing.

value.title: Burner ID
value.comment: This determines which controller is linked to this flame jet.
value.comment2: The flame jet will not function without a linked controller.

sprite.name: Signboard - Arrow
sprite.notes: A signboard with a red arrow on it, useful for suggesting a player travel in a specific direction.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: This determines which direction the arrow will point in.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-Order of the Signboard placing it further behind other sprites.

sprite.name: Mega Icicle
sprite.notes: A large hanging icicle that can fall if the player comes too close to it. It can also be triggered by a Snake Block.

dependency.notes: The Mega Icicle has several options that function specifically with the Snake Block.

dualbox.comment: When set to Child, the icicle will not fall, because a child icicle waits for its parent to fall. Parent icicles create their own child with their own settings, with nybble 5 forced turned on.

checkbox.title: Parent: Delete after Child fell
checkbox.comment: If unchecked, the parent actor stays around, doing nothing
checkbox.comment2: Parent goes into ParentCreateWait after telling child to fall if 0, deletes itself instead otherwise. ParentCreateWait is an empty state though - it just waits and does nothing. It was possibly confused with the 'ParentWait' state, which is set up in a way that would allow it to create an icicle every time. This behaviour would also explain the weird (and currently useless) design of parent / child icicle actors.

checkbox.title: Use Growing Animation
checkbox.comment: Any nonzero value causes it to go into a growing animation.
checkbox.comment2: During the animation, the scale is increased from 0 to 1 in 4 frames: 0, 0.4, 0.8, 1

list.title: Second Falling Animation
list.comment: This determines the animation the Icicle uses after falling off the Snake Block, or the terrain underneath it is otherwise removed.
list.comment2: If set to 0 or 1, the Icicle will fall through any other terrain and despawn. If set to 2, it will still interact with other Layer 1 terrain after falling.

dualbox.comment: If player: Any player needs to be closer than 8 blocks horizontally. If snake block: The horizontal distance can be configured.

value.title: Snake Block: Fall Distance
value.comment: Number of blocks

list.title: Tilt after Falling
list.comment: When enabled, the Icicle will tilt to the right (?) after it falls.

sprite.name: Stretching Line Block Controller
sprite.notes: A controller that allows you to link the movement patterns of Stretching Line Blocks together for predictable jumping.

dependency.notes: This controller only affects [219] Stretching Line Blocks allowing for the movement synchronization of multiple platforms.

value.title: Stretch ID
value.comment: This pairs matching platforms to this controller for movement synchronization.

value.title: Movement Distance
value.comment: This determines the distance between the top and bottom states for all paired platforms.
value.comment2: This will also override the Movement Distance setting of all paired platforms.

sprite.name: Wiggling Mushroom Platform Controller
sprite.notes: A controller that allows you to link the movement patterns of Wiggling Mushroom Platforms together for predictable jumping.

dependency.notes: This controller only affects [231] Wiggling Mushroom Platform allowing for the movement synchronization of multiple platforms.

value.title: Wiggling Mushroom ID
value.comment: This pairs matching platforms to this controller for movement synchronization.

value.title: Wiggle Speed
value.comment: This speed will override the Wiggle Speed setting of all paired platforms.

sprite.name: Effect - Bubble Spawner
sprite.notes: A Bubble Spawner that creates occasional rising air bubbles from the placement of the sprite.

dependency.notes: [317] Enables Bubbles must exist in the Zone in order for the bubbles to show.

list.title: Size of Bubbles
list.comment: This determines the size of the bubbles that will spawn.

sprite.name: Movement Controller - Bolt
sprite.notes: A wide-head bolt that will cause other sprites to move if the player shakes their controller while standing on top of it.

dependency.notes: This type of Bolt can influence five other sprites.

value.title: Bolt ID
value.comment: This pairs matching Bolt Controlled sprites with this Bolt.

value.title: Distance
value.comment: This determines the maximum number of blocks that other sprites will move when spinning this Bolt.

sprite.name: Bolt Controlled Metal Block
sprite.notes: A metal block that can also be made to move by spinning a Bolt.

dependency.notes: This sprite must be paired with a [315] Bolt in order to function.

value.title: Bolt ID
value.comment: This pairs the block with a matching Bolt.

checkbox.title: Moves from Bolt
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the metal block will move when the matching Bolt is spun.

list.title: Movement Direction
list.comment: This determines which direction the metal block will move.

list.title: Height
list.comment: This determines the height of the block.

list.title: Width
list.comment: This determines the width of the block.

sprite.name: Effect - Enables Bubbles
sprite.notes: This sprite must be placed in order for certain types of effects involving bubbles to function properly.

dependency.notes: This controller is required in order for several other sprites to function properly. See the suggested sprites for the effect this controller has on them.

sprite.name: Box Spawner
sprite.notes: A spawner that will create random sizes of boxes.

dependency.notes: The boxes will fall below where the spawner is, so it's recommended to include something to move the boxes after they fall.

dualbox.comment: This determines the type of box.

sprite.name: (Unused) Wiimote Controlled Door
sprite.notes: Graphically identical to 320. Spawns a giant door that loads in front of Mario. Cannot be forced behind Mario, and he cannot be made to enter it. By tilting the Wii Remote you can make it open.

sprite.name: (Unused) Sliding Wiimote Controlled Door
sprite.notes: Graphically identical to 319. Spawns a giant door that loads in front of Mario. Cannot be forced behind Mario, and he cannot be made to enter it. By tilting the Wii Remote you can make it slide.

sprite.name: (Unused) Beta Arrow Block
sprite.notes: A strange unused block with an arrow that can rotate when the block is ground-pounded. There is also a glitchy and unused association with the Auto-Scrolling Controller.

list.title: Starting Arrow Direction
list.comment: This determines which direction the arrow will initially point.

checkbox.title: Ground-Pound Rotate
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the arrow on the block will rotate 90 degrees when the block is ground-pounded.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the arrow will rotate.

sprite.name: Incomplete Sprite - 'En_Ghost_Jugem'
sprite.notes: Does nothing.

sprite.name: Boo Circle
sprite.notes: A circle of Boos that can rotate along a central point. It will always have one opening for the player to pass through.

value.title: Greater Radius Distance
value.comment: This determines the maximum radius of the Boo Circle. It must be larger or equal to the Lesser Radius.

value.title: Lesser Radius Distance
value.comment: This determines the minimum radius of the Boo Circle. It must be smaller or equal to the Greater Radius.

value.title: Shrink/Expand Delay
value.comment: This determines the delay between shrinking/expanding, if the Radius Distances are not equal. A value of 1 is approximately equal to one game second.

list.title: Shrink/Expand Effects
list.comment: This determines the speed (or other effects used) when shrinking/expanding. This speed is not influenced by the distance of the radius they travel.
list.comment2:
Instant: The boos will flicker instantly between the greater and lesser radius distance.
Vanish: On load, the boos will fade out from their greater radius distance and will not return.
Go Offscreen: On load, the boos will fly from their greater radius distance through the middle of the circle and through the other side until they are completely off screen and will not return.

sprite.name: Incomplete Sprite - 'Ship_Window'
sprite.notes: Does nothing.

sprite.name: Ghost House Stand
sprite.notes: A decorative stand that cannot be interacted with, typically used inside Ghost House levels.

dependency.notes: Including a few [262] Poltergeist Item versions of this will keep the player alert and on guard.

sprite.name: King Bill
sprite.notes: A very very large Bullet Bill that can only be properly used in levels with an Auto-Scrolling Controller.

dependency.notes: The King Bill will only properly function if used in an Auto-Scrolling level. This is because the King Bill sprite is more of a spawner than a normal enemy. Once the sprite it loaded on screen, it will spawn a single King Bill. If the spawner leaves the screen and then comes back onto the screen, it will spawn another King Bill. This becomes excessively dangerous and unpredictable. Additionally, a King Bill being fired to the right will only spawn after its spawner has passed the left edge of the screen. If you find other restrictions, please post about them so they can be added.

value.title: Speed
value.comment: This determines the speed of the King Bill.
value.comment2: A value of 5 is equal to Mario's Maximum Running Speed.

value.title: Delay Before Spawn
value.comment: This determines the delay before the King Bill spawns after the sprite is loaded.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: This determines the direction the King Bill is fired in.

sprite.name: Line Controlled Platform with Bolt
sprite.notes: A platform that rides along line objects. Once activated by the Bolt on top of it, it will advance in an rightwards direction and continue along the line. If the player stops spinning, it will move in reverse until it reaches a stop node.

value.title: Speed
value.comment: This determines the speed at which the platform will travel.
value.comment2: The platform will not move if Speed is set to 0.

sprite.name: (Unused) (Incomplete) Bubble Cannon
sprite.yoshinotes: The game will crash if Yoshi flutters while touching a 'bubble.'
sprite.notes: This loads a flat texture that says 'temporary' in Japanese letters, and shoots out more of the same. If it's moving up, you can hold the jump button while the player is on the 'bubble' to hold onto it for a very short amount of time. They will despawn if they hit a wall.

value.title: Bubble Cannon ID
value.comment: This pairs the object to a matching Bubble Cannon Controller. It works on its own if left at 0.

list.title: Bubble Size
list.comment: This determines the size of the bubble.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: This determines the direction the bubble is launched in, and Mario is pushed

value.title: Bubble Speed
value.comment: This determines the speed the bubble travel, and the force Mario is pushed by.

value.title: Bubble Spawn Delay
value.comment: This determines the delay between bubble spawns.

sprite.name: (Unused) (Incomplete) Bubble Cannon Controller
sprite.notes: A controller for the Bubble Cannon. It overrides the settings of the paired Bubble Cannon, but it's recommended to use identical settings. Because reasons.

value.title: Bubble Cannon ID
value.comment: This pairs the controller to a matching Bubble Cannon for functionality.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: This determines the direction the bubble is launched in.

value.title: Bubble Speed
value.comment: This determines the speed the bubble travel, and the force Mario is pushed by.

value.title: Bubble Initial Spawn Delay
value.comment: This determines the delay before the first bubble spawn.

value.title: Bubble Spawn Delay
value.comment: This determines the delay between bubble spawns.

sprite.name: Rope Ladder
sprite.notes: A climbable rope ladder that is affected by Wind Physics.

sprite.name: Rotation Controlled Dish Platform
sprite.notes: A bowl shaped platform that can be paired to rotation controllers.

dependency.notes: This platform can be paired to a rotation controller.

dualbox.comment: This determines the length of the platform.

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: This pairs the platform to a matching rotation controller.

sprite.name: Incomplete Sprite - 'Lift_Toride_Roll'
sprite.notes: Does nothing.

sprite.name: Line Controlled Player-Block Platform
sprite.notes: A tilt controlled platform that only activates when a player strikes the Player Block. It will zip from one end of a line guide to the other when the controlling player tilts their controller.

dependency.notes: This platform will not move along line objects without the use of [187] Player Block.

sprite.name: Big Cheep Cheep / Big Deep Cheep / Big Eep Cheep
sprite.notes: A larger version of the basic Cheep Cheep and its very similar brethren. When placed in water, it will swim along or even swim after the player.

dependency.notes: The Cheep Cheep will only spawn if placed within water. In addition, Deep Cheeps and the Eep Cheep only work on non-location water.

checkbox.title: Swims Left
checkbox.comment: If checked, swims to the left. The fish will not swim backwards when you backtrack. If unchecked, it depends on the 'Type' set, in which Direction the Cheep Cheep swims first. For Types 3, 4, 6 and 7, it swims to the right in general. All other Types will cause the Cheep Cheeps to swim in Mario's Direction.

list.title: Type
list.comment:
Specifies the Swimming-'Type' that should be used for this Cheep Cheep. Deep Cheeps and Eep Cheeps only work in non-Location water. Value 5 is unique. Type-5 Cheep Cheeps will look into the camera until Mario comes close. Furthermore, the Direction will be ignored and the Cheep Cheep will always swim in the opposite Direction, away from Mario, but only if Mario is close enough.
Values marked with an asterisk (*) will ignore the speed Value set and instead will always use Value 1, no matter what is selected there. Also, all Values with (*) will let the Cheep Cheep swim in a wavy line (just as the Coin Cheep Cheep does).
The two Values with (**) follow exactly the same behavior as those marked with (*), only difference is its speed. Cheep Cheeps affected will swim slightly faster, both vertical and horizontal.

New naming scheme as of NSMBU:

Red = Cheep Cheep (normal)
Green = Deep Cheep (aggressive)
Yellow = Eep Cheep (shy)
list.entry: Big Cheep Cheep ("LrSwim"), Swims Left / Right
Big Cheep Cheep ("WaterWait"), Waits, Then Swims Straight**
Big Deep Cheep ("SrcSwim"), Follows Player Slightly*
Big Deep Cheep ("ScrSwim"), Follows Player Slightly*

list.title: Swim Speed
list.comment: This determines the swimming speed of [?????] Types of Cheep Cheep.
list.comment2: Note: Type-3 Cheep Cheeps (Swims Left / Right) have the same speed as values 1 and 2. [Both? What? Slow and Medium-Slow?]

list.title: Swim Distance
list.comment: This determines the distance that a Type 3 Cheep Cheep will swim in both directions from its initial placement.

value.title: 'Dodge' Event ID
value.comment:
Right, this does look weird at first glance, but it seems as if this function should work. It definitely has to do with Type 3 (Swims Left / Right). Treeki wrote this: 'LrSwim (Type 3) accepts an Event that will make the Cheep Cheep follow the player (turning state LrSwim into state LrSrcSwim)'.
If it really works is a good question.

sprite.name: School of Cheep Cheeps
sprite.notes: Creates a formation of four Cheep Cheeps.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the Cheep Cheeps will swim in when they spawn.

checkbox.title: Slower
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Cheep Cheeps will swim much slower while maintaining their formation.

value.title: # of Big Cheep Cheeps
value.comment: This determines the number of Big Cheep Cheeps in the formation.

list.title: Formation Categories
list.comment: This determines which Formation Types and sets sub-variants of the formation selected are available.
list.comment2: Some formation types and variants will have issues. Experiment to find the one best for your level.

list.title: Formation Type: Category 1
list.comment: The Sprite's placement represents the topmost Cheep Cheep from the group.

list.title: Formation Type: Category 2
list.comment: The Sprite's placement represents the bottom-most Cheep Cheep from the group.

list.title: Formation Type: Category 3
list.comment: For Values 0 and 1, the Sprite's placement represents the left-most/bottom-most Cheep Cheep from the group. For Value 2, the Sprite's placement is located 5 Blocks above the bottom-most Cheep Cheep.

list.title: Formation Type: Category 4
list.comment: For Values 0 and 1, the Sprite's placement represents the bottom-most Cheep Cheep from the group. For Value 2, the Sprite's placement is located 5 Blocks above the bottom-most Cheep Cheep.

sprite.name: Wendy Koopa
sprite.yoshinotes: Yoshi can only be hurt while the boss is inside its shell and spinning around. Additionally, Yoshi will despawn the boss entirely if he ground pounds it, softlocking the game.

dependency.notes: Requires the Tower Boss Controller to start moving on her own and complete the level after she's beat. Otherwise, she will start moving when damaged.

sprite.name: Iggy Koopa
sprite.yoshinotes: Yoshi can only be hurt while the boss is inside its shell and spinning around. Additionally, Yoshi will despawn the boss entirely if he ground pounds it, softlocking the game.

dependency.notes: Requires the Tower Boss Controller to start moving on his own and complete the level after he's beat. Otherwise, he will start moving when damaged.

value.title: Rising/Falling Speed
value.comment: Values 0-3 are each very different from each other, while Values 4+ have very minimal increases in speed beyond that.

value.title: Z-Order
value.comment: This will adjust the Z-Order of the Bullet Bills in relation to other Launchers. See Retail: 07-04 A1 Z5.
value.comment2: The z-order is 400 - 32 * value

value.title: Unknown Value 5-6
value.comments: ASM shows Nybble 5-6 might affect something.

value.title: Unknown Value 6
value.comment: ASM shows Nybble 6 alone might affect something.

sprite.name: Moving Pipe - Facing Up
sprite.notes: An upwards facing Pipe that moves between two heights.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the Pipe.
list.advancedcomment: Moving Pipes use obj_dokan.arc.

list.title: Height 1
list.comment: This determines the height of the Pipe during the first state.

list.title: Height 2
list.comment: This determines the height of the Pipe during the second state.

value.title: Rising / Lowering Speed
value.comment: This determines how quickly the Pipe will move when switching between Height 1 and Height 2.
value.comment2: Values 0-3 are each very different from each other, while Values 4+ have very minimal increases in speed beyond that.

sprite.name: Lemmy Koopa
sprite.yoshinotes: Yoshi can only be hurt while the boss is inside its shell and spinning around. Lemmy's balls won't push Yoshi aside, and Yoshi will slide down if standing on one. Additionally, Yoshi will despawn the boss entirely if he ground pounds it, softlocking the game.

dependency.notes: Requires the Tower Boss Controller to start moving on his own and complete the level after he's beat. Otherwise, he will start moving when damaged.

sprite.name: Giant Koopa Shell Cave
sprite.notes: A decorative large shell that can be used as a cave with the right arrangement of invisible blocks and settings.

dependency.notes: Look in Retail 5-01 A1 for an example of how to use this sprite correctly. You will need to make use of Spotlight Lighting, Layer 0 tiles, and invisible collision blocks in order for it to look correct.

checkbox.title: Remove Grass/Rocks
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this will remove the decoration from the bottom of the Shell Cave.

sprite.name: Muncher
sprite.yoshinotes: Unlike in SMW, if Yoshi touches a Muncher, he will become hurt and will run away.
sprite.notes: This sprite spawns the invisible spike tile from Pa0 as its collision. As a result, the Muncher must be placed on the tile grid for the hitbox to work properly. This also means the Muncher only has a hurtbox on the top by default. Off-grid Munchers spawn the spike tile at the top left grid position.

checkbox.title: Frozen
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Muncher will be frozen. It can be thawed with a fireball. The ice collision matches with off-grid frozen Munchers until they are melted.

dependency.notes: Use the Group Controller [236] for spawn synchronization with other Group controlled sprites.

value.title: Group ID
value.comment: This pairs the Fuzzy to a matching Group Controller for spawn synchronization with other Group controlled sprites.

list.title: Speed
list.comment: Line Controlled sprites use the same speed setting across all of them.

sprite.name: Morton Koopa
sprite.yoshinotes: Yoshi can only be hurt while the boss is inside its shell and spinning around. Additionally, Yoshi will despawn the boss entirely if he ground pounds it, softlocking the game.

dependency.notes: Requires the Tower Boss Controller to start moving on his own and complete the level after he's beat. Otherwise, he will start moving when damaged. Additionally, the Morton fight allows placement of [480] Morton's Skewer, a much more timing-sensitive spiked pillar.

sprite.name: Hanging Chain Holder
sprite.notes: A decorative ring attached to the wall. It is intended to be used with the Hanging Chain Platform, and is what the chains are supposed to attach to.

dependency.notes: This should be placed directly on the Rotation Controller used with [346] Hanging Chain Platform. However, it can be used as unrelated decoration if desired.

sprite.name: Rotation Controlled Hanging Chain Platform
sprite.notes: A rotation controlled platform that has two hanging hooks on it. These hooks will automatically create chains that lead directly to the rotation point that is used.

dependency.notes: Placement of this platform is flexible, but it is recommended that it be placed directly below the rotation controller. Additionally, the platform will generate two chains leading to the rotation controller it is paired with. A [345] Hanging Chain Holder should be placed directly on top of the rotation controller.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-Order of the Platform placing it further behind other sprites.

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: This pairs the platform to a matching rotation controller.

sprite.name: Roy Koopa
sprite.yoshinotes: Yoshi can only be hurt while the boss is inside its shell and spinning around. Additionally, Yoshi will despawn the boss entirely if he ground pounds it, softlocking the game.

dependency.notes: Requires the Tower Boss Controller to start moving on his own and complete the level after he's beat. Otherwise, he will start moving when damaged.

sprite.name: Ludwig von Koopa
sprite.yoshinotes: Yoshi can only be hurt while the boss is inside its shell and spinning around. Additionally, Yoshi will despawn the boss entirely if he ground pounds it, softlocking the game.

dependency.notes: Requires the Tower Boss Controller to start moving on his own and complete the level after he's beat. Otherwise, he will start moving when damaged.

sprite.name: Morton Koopa - Castle Boss
sprite.yoshinotes: Yoshi can only be hurt while the boss is inside its shell and spinning around. Additionally, Yoshi will despawn the boss entirely if he ground pounds it, softlocking the game.
sprite.notes: The boss initially has no collision. The pillars will lower 1 block when the fight begins. The white square indicates the placement for the Castle Boss controller. Mario spawns at Entrance 3 after the battle.

dependency.notes: For more help setting up the boss room, see the zone from the original game.

sprite.name: Incomplete Sprite - 'Dummy_Door_Parent'
sprite.notes: Does nothing.

sprite.name: Incomplete Sprite - 'Dummy_Door_Child'
sprite.notes: Does nothing.

sprite.name: Rocky Wrench
sprite.notes: A small mole that will hide under a metal cover and throw wrenches at the player. It can be defeated with a ground pound or fireball, or it can be frozen.

dependency.notes: The Rocky Wrench must be placed with its feet touching the ground.

sprite.name: Moving Pipe - Facing Down
sprite.notes: A downwards facing Pipe that moves between two heights.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the Pipe.
list.advancedcomment: Moving Pipes use obj_dokan.arc.

list.title: Height 1
list.comment: This determines the height of the Pipe during the first state.

list.title: Height 2
list.comment: This determines the height of the Pipe during the second state.

value.title: Rising / Lowering Speed
value.comment: This determines how quickly the Pipe will move when switching between Height 1 and Height 2.
value.comment2: Values 0-3 are each very different from each other, while Values 4+ have very minimal increases in speed beyond that.

sprite.name: Brown Tower Block - Two Way Line
sprite.notes: A resizable block platform that was used in retail NSMBW's Tower levels. This version can have Two Way Line synchronized movement applied to it.

dependency.notes: This block must be paired with a [260] Two Way Line movement controller in order to appear and function.

value.title: Two Way Line ID
value.comment: This pairs the block to a matching Two Way Line movement controller.

list.title: Height
list.comment: This determines how tall the block is.

list.title: Width
list.comment: This determines how wide the block is.

sprite.name: Rolling Hill - 1 Pipe
sprite.yoshinotes: Yoshi cannot enter the pipe.
sprite.notes: A rotating circle with one pipe in it that has the same general appearance as the standard Grass or Underground tilesets.

dependency.notes: A functioning entrance is required to be associated with the Rolling Hill or the game will crash. Also, the underside of a Rolling Hill does NOT have collision. Do not place a Rolling Hill in any situation where the player would have contact with the bottom 50% of the hill.

dualbox.comment: This determines which texture the Rolling Hill will use.

list.title: Starting Rotation
list.comment: This determines the initial angle the hill spawns at before spinning. It measures clockwise.

value.title: Speed
value.comment: This determines the rotation speed of the Rolling Hill. A value of 5 matches Mario's running speed, so use of higher values isn't recommended.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the Rolling Hill rolls.

value.title: Z-Order
value.comment: This will adjust the Z-Order of the Rolling Hill in relation to other Rolling Hills.
value.comment2: If you have multiple Rolling Hills overlapping each other, you must use this setting to prevent graphical glitches. Rolling Hills with a higher Z-Order number will show behind those with a lower number.

value.title: Entrance ID
value.comment: This determines the Entrance ID that the pipe will connect with.
value.comment2: It does not have to be placed on the pipe. It can only be used as an exit.

sprite.name: Brown Tower Block
sprite.notes: A resizable block platform similar to the one used in retail NSMBW's Tower levels. Be aware that you cannot synchronize this block for level-wide timing purposes.

list.title: Height
list.comment: This determines how tall the block is.

list.title: Width
list.comment: This determines how wide the block is.

list.title: Movement Direction
list.comment: This determines the initial direction the block will travel.

checkbox.title: Start Delay
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the block will wait two game seconds before moving. After the initial movement has occurred, this becomes irrelevant.

value.title: Delay Before Movement
value.comment: This determines how long the block will wait before making its outwards movement.
value.comment2: Each value is equal to two game seconds.

value.title: Distance
value.comment: This defines how many tiles the block will move before returning to its starting position.

value.title: Delay Before Return
value.comment: This determines how long the block will wait before making its return movement.
value.comment2: Each value is equal to two game seconds.

list.title: Speed
list.comment: This determines the speed of the block's movement.

checkbox.title: Event Activated
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the block will only appear if the Triggering Event ID is activated.
checkbox.comment2: Note: The block will not disappear when the event is deactivated for as long as it remains loaded on screen. The player must place enough distance between them and the block's spawning location for it to despawn.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This determines which Event must be activated for the platform to appear.

sprite.name: Yoshi Fruit
sprite.notes: An edible fruit that Yoshi can grab. Collecting five will cause Yoshi to lay an egg. What's inside the egg will change depending on the player's current power-up. Normal -> Fire -> Ice -> Propeller -> 1-Up.

list.title: Type
list.comment: This determines if the fruit is a standard berry, or a cookie. They share no functional difference.

sprite.name: Effect - Rising Lava Particle
sprite.notes: An effects controller that creates small red particles that rise from the bottom of the screen. The density of the effect is increased for every instance of the sprite placed in the zone. It can be used alongside other effects.

list.title: Particle Frequency
list.comment: This determines the frequency of the particle effect.

sprite.name: Lighting - Fire Lamp
sprite.notes: A decorative fire lamp that generates light around it. It has no collision by default.

sprite.name: Rolling Hill - 8 Pipes
sprite.yoshinotes: Yoshi cannot enter the pipes.
sprite.notes: A rotating circle with eight pipes in it that only has the same general appearance of the standard Grass tilesets.

dependency.notes: A functioning entrance is required to be associated with the Rolling Hill or the game will crash. Also, the underside of a Rolling Hill does NOT have collision. Do not place a Rolling Hill in any situation where the player would have contact with the bottom 50% of the hill.

list.title: Starting Rotation
list.comment: This determines the initial angle the hill spawns at before spinning. It measures clockwise. Keep in mind that odd values will set the pipes to be invisible.

value.title: Speed
value.comment: This determines the rotation speed of the Rolling Hill. A value of 5 matches Mario's running speed, so use of higher values isn't recommended.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the Rolling Hill rolls.

value.title: Z-Order
value.comment: This will adjust the Z-Order of the Rolling Hill in relation to other Rolling Hills.
value.comment2: If you have multiple Rolling Hills overlapping each other, you must use this setting to prevent graphical glitches. Rolling Hills with a higher Z-Order number will show behind those with a lower number.

value.title: Entrance ID
value.comment: This determines the Entrance ID that the pipe will connect with.
value.comment2: It does not have to be placed on the pipe. It can only be used as an exit.

checkbox.title: Invisible Pipes
checkbox.advancedcomment: When enabled, the Pipes will be invisible, but still able to be entered. It was likely meant to be another texture, but was never actually added in. Do not use this setting.

sprite.name: Rotation Controlled Crystal Block
sprite.notes: A rotation controlled large purple crystal block.

dependency.notes: This block does not appear unless actually paired to a rotation controller.

list.title: Size
list.comment: This determines the size of the block.

value.title: Z-Order
value.comment: This will adjust the Z-Order of the Crystal Block in relation to other Crystal Blocks.
value.comment2: If you have multiple Crystal Blocks overlapping each other, you can use this setting to avoid some types of graphical glitches. Crystal Blocks with a higher Z-Order number will show behind those with a lower number. Unlike with Rolling Hills, it is not necessary to do this. Placing blocks with the correct distance apart can allow them to seamlessly coexist.

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: This pairs the platform to a matching rotation controller.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 6 (1)
checkbox.advancedcomment: Nintendo uses this value, but no effect was observed. Likely a removed setting.

sprite.name: Rotation Controlled Colored Box
sprite.notes: A rotation controlled large resizable block with the appearance of a patterned box.

dependency.notes: This block does not appear unless actually paired to a rotation controller.

list.title: Height
list.comment: This determines how tall the block is.

list.title: Width
list.comment: This determines how wide the block is.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines which color the block is.

value.title: Z-Order
value.comment: This will adjust the Z-Order of the Colored Box in relation to other Colored Boxes.
value.comment2: If you have multiple Colored Boxes overlapping each other, you must use this setting to prevent graphical glitches. Colored Boxes with a higher Z-Order number will show behind those with a lower number.

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: This pairs the platform to a matching rotation controller.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 6 (1)
checkbox.advancedcomment: Nintendo uses this value, but no effect was observed. Likely a removed setting.

sprite.name: Boss Controller - Tower Boss
sprite.yoshinotes: Yoshi plays an unused animation when he enters the area from a Boss Entrance. However, he lacks proper compatibility with the bosses themselves.
sprite.notes: This controls the level completion for the World 1-7 Tower battles, as well as the listed Koopaling's initial movements. Koopalings function without this controller, but they won't move until hit, and the level won't end when they are defeated.

dependency.notes: An appropriate loose Koopaling is required in order for the controller to do what it needs to. It's also required to place the sprite on a spot without terrain. See Retail X-22 for suggested room builds for Tower bosses.

list.title: Tower Boss
list.comment: This determines which Koopaling you will be fighting. When that Koopaling is defeated, the level will end.

sprite.name: Roy Koopa - Castle Boss
sprite.yoshinotes: Yoshi can only be hurt while the boss is inside its shell and spinning around. Additionally, Yoshi will despawn the boss entirely if he ground pounds it, softlocking the game.
sprite.notes: The boss initially has no collision. The white square indicates the placement for the Castle Boss controller. Mario spawns at Entrance 3 after the battle.

dependency.notes: For more help setting up the boss room, see the zone from the original game.

sprite.name: Ludwig von Koopa - Castle Boss
sprite.yoshinotes: Yoshi can only be hurt while the boss is inside its shell and spinning around. Additionally, Yoshi will despawn the boss entirely if he ground pounds it, softlocking the game.
sprite.notes: The boss initially has no collision. All tiles the sprite spawns are behind Layer 1. The white square indicates the placement for the Castle Boss controller. The rectangular outline indicates the placement of the Brick blocks destroyed during the cutscene. Mario spawns at Entrance 3 after the battle.

dependency.notes: For more help setting up the boss room, see the zone from the original game.

sprite.name: Rotation Controlled Mushroom Block
sprite.notes: A rotation controlled mushroom block with two different sizes.

dependency.notes: This block does not appear unless actually paired to a rotation controller.

list.title: Type
list.comment: This determines the color and size of the block.

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: This pairs the platform to a matching rotation controller.

sprite.name: Line Controlled Spinning Pink Mushroom Block
sprite.notes: A large mushroom block that automatically rotates from its center point and will move along Line objects after the player touches it.

dependency.notes: Line objects are required for this sprite to function. It does not interact with other terrain, and will instead continue to follow the Line guide it is connected to. As with all Line controlled sprites, it will connect to a new Line guide when it falls off of its current one, if it touches one. [???]

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: When the mushroom block is stepped on by a player, in addition to starting to move, the Target Event ID will be activated.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the mushroom block will rotate in.

value.title: Rotation Speed
value.comment: This determines the speed the mushroom block will rotate.
value.comment2: The mushroom block will always rotate even at a speed value of 0.

value.title: Travel Speed
value.comment: This determines the speed the mushroom block will travel along Line objects.

checkbox.title: Bounce Back
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the mushroom block will reverse its course along the Line guide when it reaches an end point.
checkbox.comment2: The mushroom block will always rotate in the same direction, even when traveling in reverse.

value.title: Unknown Value 11
value.advancedcomment: Used by Nintendo in Retail 2-06 A1 as value 7. No visible effect.

sprite.name: Lighting - Path Controlled Flashlight Raft
sprite.notes: A floating Raft that travels slowly to the right, or follows along an assigned Path. It also has a flashlight that produces a cone of light on both sides that can be controlled by tilting the controller. It is activated when all players land on it.

dependency.notes: The sprite's placement is irrelevant if Path Controlled, as the Raft will be located at the listed Starting Path Node (indicated by the white square). A special Water sprite [373] is recommended to be used with the Raft, but it's not required.

checkbox.title: Uses Paths
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Raft will follow the assigned Path. Otherwise, the Raft will move slowly to the right.

value.title: Starting Node
value.comment: This determines the Node of the Path that the Raft will appear at and start moving from.

dualbox.comment: This decides whether the Raft will spawn only before the Midway Flag is activated, or only after.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 8 (1)
checkbox.advancedcomment: When this flag is enabled along with a Path (regardless of the Uses Paths flag), the Raft will go to the indicated Path Node and not move. But, if the Path is set to loop, this doesn't do anything.

checkbox.title: Event Activated Flashlight
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Flashlight will only be illuminated when the Triggering Event ID is activated. The Flashlight can only be controlled by tilting the controller when it is Event Activated.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: The Flashlight will be turned on when this Event ID is activated. The Flashlight can't be deactivated.

sprite.name: Cooligan
sprite.yoshinotes: Yoshi cannot jump on Cooligans, though he can use the stomp attack and tongue attack to defeat them.

sprite.name: Lakitu Cloud Block
sprite.notes: A block that when struck from below will spawn a Lakitu enemy that throws coins instead of Spinies.

value.title: Maximum Coins Thrown (*5)
value.comment: This determines how many coins the Lakitu will throw before flying off.
value.comment2: A value of 1 is equal to 5 coins across 15 game seconds. If set to 0, the Lakitu will never fly off.

value.title: Spawn Height
value.comment: This determines the distance relative to the bottom border of the Zone, in which the Lakitu will float upwards before it begins to throw coins.
value.comment2: At value 0, the top of the Lakitu's shell will reach 12 blocks above the bottom Zone border. Each additional value increases this by two blocks. A value of 4 is equal to the standard height of a [134] Lakitu Spawn Area's Lakitu spawn.

sprite.name: Rolling Hill Coin
sprite.notes: A coin that will rotate around a standard Rolling Hill.

dependency.notes: The coin may be placed anywhere within the zone, but it is suggested to place it nearby the relevant [212] Rolling Hill. It must be paired to a standard Rolling Hill in order to function, but it can be staged to work with any type of Rolling Hill. Just place a smaller standard Rolling Hill in a way that it is hidden behind the Rolling Hill with Pipe(s), and increase the coin's distance as needed.

value.title: Hill ID
value.comment: This pairs the coins to a matching standard Rolling Hill.

value.title: Distance from Hill Surface
value.comment: This determines how many blocks away from the surface of the Rolling Hill the coin will rotate at.

value.title: Spacing
value.comment: This determines the angle of the coin around the Rolling Hill.
value.comment2: Each increment is equal to 1.40625°, or 1/256 of the circle. A value of 0 places the coin directly above the hill, and it increases in a clockwise direction. Recommended values for complete groupings of coins are factors of 4, 8, 16, or 32. Factors of 1 and 2 are not recommended as the coins will overlap. If not covering the entire hill, any factors can be used, but consistency is recommended.

list.title: Spacing - Major Parts
list.comment: This determines the angle of the coin around the Rolling Hill.
list.comment2: Each increment is equal to 22.5°, with 0 being directly above the hill, and increasing in a clockwise direction.

list.title: Spacing - Sub Parts
list.comment: This determines the angle of the coin around the Rolling Hill.
list.comment2: Each increment is equal to an increase of 1.40625°, with 0 being the start of the value above, increasing in a clockwise direction.

sprite.name: Iggy Koopa - Castle Boss
sprite.yoshinotes: Yoshi can only be hurt while the boss is inside its shell and spinning around. Additionally, Yoshi will despawn the boss entirely if he ground pounds it, softlocking the game.
sprite.notes: The boss initially has no collision. The rectangular outline shows the path Iggy takes during the fight. The white square indicates the placement for the Castle Boss controller. Mario spawns at Entrance 3 after the battle.

dependency.notes: For more help setting up the boss room, see the zone from the original game.

sprite.name: Flashlight Raft Water
sprite.notes: This is the Water that is used with the Flashlight Raft. It will rise and fall along the Path indicated by the Flashlight Raft.

dependency.notes: This must be included with the [368] Flashlight Raft in order to function. Do not include more than one in a Zone.

sprite.name: Effect - Snow and Wind
sprite.notes: This effect controller will either create falling snow, or it will create a Sandstorm.

dependency.notes: If this sprite is placed more than once in the same Zone, the game will crash. If Sandstorm is selected, you must include [90] Wind Physics and Sound.

dualbox.comment: This determines the functionality of the sprite.

sprite.name: Wendy Koopa - Castle Boss
sprite.yoshinotes: Yoshi can only be hurt while the boss is inside its shell and spinning around. Yoshi can't swim, so he will automatically be dismounted when submerged. Additionally, Yoshi will despawn the boss entirely if he ground pounds it, softlocking the game.
sprite.notes: The boss initially has no collision. The water spawned draws as long as shown, and has no collision until the fight begins. white square indicates the placement for the Castle Boss controller. Mario spawns at Entrance 3 after the battle.

dependency.notes: For more help setting up the boss room, see the zone from the original game.

sprite.name: Moving Chainlink Fence Panel
sprite.notes: A climbable chainlink fence panel that can move in a back and forth direction. It will appear in front of Layer 1, so is must have Layer 0 tiles painted to make it appear behind terrain.

sprite.name: Warp Pipe - Up
sprite.notes: A non-tileset pipe that cannot be entered. To enter Blue pipes, create a tileset pipe underneath the sprite.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the Pipe.

value.title: Length
value.comment: This determines the length of the Pipe.

sprite.name: Warp Pipe - Down
sprite.notes: A non-tileset pipe that cannot be entered. To enter Blue pipes, create a tileset pipe underneath the sprite.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the Pipe.

value.title: Length
value.comment: This determines the length of the Pipe.

sprite.name: Warp Pipe - Right
sprite.notes: A non-tileset pipe that cannot be entered. To enter Blue pipes, create a tileset pipe underneath the sprite.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the Pipe.

value.title: Length
value.comment: This determines the length of the Pipe.

sprite.name: Warp Pipe - Left
sprite.notes: A non-tileset pipe that cannot be entered. To enter Blue pipes, create a tileset pipe underneath the sprite.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the Pipe.

value.title: Length
value.comment: This determines the length of the Pipe.

sprite.name: Lemmy Koopa - Castle Boss
sprite.yoshinotes: Yoshi can only be hurt while the boss is inside its shell and spinning around. Lemmy's balls won't push Yoshi aside, and Yoshi will slide down if standing on one. Additionally, Yoshi will despawn the boss entirely if he ground pounds it, softlocking the game.
sprite.notes: The boss initially has no collision. The 2 blocks on the side will fall when the fight begins. The white square indicates the placement for the Castle Boss controller. Mario spawns at Entrance 3 after the battle.

dependency.notes: For more help setting up the boss room, see the zone from the original game.

sprite.name: Screw Mushroom Platform without Bolt
sprite.notes: A mechanical biological hybrid of a mushroom platform that can be magically controlled by nearby similar platforms with Bolts.

value.title: Mushroom ID
value.comment: This pairs the platform to a matching Mushroom Platform with a Bolt.
value.comment2: You cannot have more than one pair of Screw Platforms with the same Mushroom ID.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the platform will move when the matching Bolt is spun.

value.title: Distance
value.comment: This determines how far the platform will move when the matching Bolt is spun.

list.title: Movement Speed
list.comment: This determines the speed of the platform in the direction specified above. The 'returning' speed (0.2) is unaffected.

value.title: Unknown Value 7-8
value.advancedcomment: Used (1) in Retail: 01-05 A1.

sprite.name: Boss Controller - Kamek
sprite.notes:
Kamek himself can be placed anywhere within the Zone, as the controller's placement itself determines his spawn position.

The blocks move left and despawn when their right edges reach the left border, and respawn from their right edge on the right border.

dependency.notes: For more help setting up the boss room, see the zone from the original game.

sprite.name: Cooligan Spawner
sprite.yoshinotes: Yoshi cannot jump on penguins, though he can use the stomp attack and tongue attack to defeat them.
sprite.notes: Pipes are not required for the spawner to work.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the Penguin will spawn from.

sprite.name: Grabbable Ice Block
sprite.notes: A grabbable ice block that is affected by gravity. It can be picked up and thrown by shaking the controller next to it. When it is thrown, it will damage enemies (not players) that it hits, and it will shatter.

list.title: Height
list.comment: This determines the vertical size of the block.

list.title: Width
list.comment: This determines the horizontal size of the block.

sprite.name: POW Block
sprite.notes: A grabbable POW block that is affected by gravity. It can be picked up and thrown by shaking the controller next to it. If it is thrown and it hits the ground, it will activate and cause the POW effect, killing many types of enemies, knocking coins loose, and other special effects.

sprite.name: Bush
sprite.notes: A decorative leafy bush that appears behind Layer 1 terrain.

checkbox.title: Yellowish Bush
checkbox.comment: This makes the Bush a yellowish color.

list.title: Size
list.comment: This determines the size of the Bush. Larger sizes use different models.

sprite.name: Barrel
sprite.notes: A grabbable barrel that is affected by gravity. It can be picked up and thrown by shaking the controller next to it. If it is thrown and it hits the ground, it will begin to roll until it hits an enemy or a wall. It can also hurt other players.

sprite.name: Bolt Controlled Star Coin
sprite.notes: A Star Coin variant that moves when a matching Bolt is spun.

dependency.notes: This sprite must be paired to a [315] Bolt in order to function.

value.title: Bolt ID
value.comment: This pairs the Star Coin with a matching Bolt.

list.title: Movement Direction
list.comment: This determines which direction the Star Coin will move.

value.title: Distance Multiplier
value.comment: This determines the number of blocks that the Star Coin will move for every equivalent one block of distance the matching Bolt is spun.
value.comment2: For example, if the Bolt's distance is 10, and the Star Coin's distance multiplier is 4, the Star Coin will move a total of 40 blocks. The time it takes for the Star Coin to travel the full distance is unaffected no matter what the distance multiplier is.

list.title: Coin Number
list.comment: This determines which Star Coin flag will be set for the level when this Star Coin is collected.
list.comment2: If multiple Star Coins with the same number are placed, duplicate entries will not load if the player has already collected one that attempt.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Chainlink Fence
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Star Coin can only be collected if the player is on the reverse side of a Chainlink Fence.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: When the Star Coin is collected, the Target Event ID will be activated.

dualbox.comment: This determines if the Target Event is timed or permanent. Timed events will pause the music and replace it with ticking.

value.title: Unknown Value 8
value.advancedcomment: ASM shows Nybble 8 might affect something.

sprite.name: Bolt Controlled Coin
sprite.notes: A standard Coin variant that moves when a matching Bolt is spun.

dependency.notes: This sprite must be paired to a [315] Bolt in order to function.

value.title: Bolt ID
value.comment: This pairs the Coin with a matching Bolt.

list.title: Movement Direction
list.comment: This determines which direction the Coin will move.

value.title: Distance Multiplier
value.comment: This determines the number of blocks that the Coin will move for every equivalent one block of distance the matching Bolt is spun.
value.comment2: For example, if the Bolt's distance is 10, and the Coin's distance multiplier is 4, the Coin will move a total of 40 blocks. The time it takes for the Coin to travel the full distance is unaffected no matter what the distance multiplier is.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-order of the Platform placing it further behind other sprites.

sprite.name: Lighting - Glow Block
sprite.notes: A grabbable glowing block that is affected by gravity. It can be picked up and thrown by shaking the controller next to it. If it is thrown and it hits the ground, it will bounce slightly. Its effect is severely diminished as anything other than a weapon of destruction if not using Full Darkness lighting.

checkbox.title: Do not despawn
checkbox.comment: If ticked, the glow block does not despawn once it has gone off-screen.
checkbox.comment2: Every nonzero value has the same effect.

sprite.name: Magic Fireball Spawn Area
sprite.notes: This sprite spawns Koopaling Fireballs from the screen's edge towards the players. The fireballs are unaffected by terrain and will travel across the entire screen unhindered.

value.title: Location ID
