value.comment: The fireballs will only spawn while a player is in this Location. However, this sprite works without a Location.

list.title: Color of Fireballs
list.comment: This determines the color of the fireball. Different colored fireballs do not have different effects.

list.title: Rate of Fire
list.comment: This determines the frequency of the fireball spawns, in real seconds. In retail levels, Nintendo used 12 and 14.

dualbox.comment: This determines the portion of the screen the fireballs will appear from. The fireballs will appear from the opposite side of Mario's position on the screen.

checkbox.title: Always Appear from Above
checkbox.comment: When this is set, the fireballs will always spawn just above the center of the screen. Otherwise, they will appear from the top or bottom side of the screen opposite to Mario's position.

sprite.name: Propeller Block
sprite.notes: A grabbable propeller block that is affected by gravity. It can be picked up and thrown by shaking the controller next to it. It can also boost the player into the air like a Propeller Cap if the player shakes their controller a second time while holding it. If it is thrown and it hits the ground, it will bounce slightly.

sprite.name: Bouncing Lemmy Ball
sprite.yoshinotes: Lemmy's balls won't push Yoshi aside, and Yoshi will slide down if standing on one.
sprite.notes: A stand-alone version of the bouncing ball used in the Lemmy Koopa boss fights.

dualbox.comment: This determines the direction the Lemmy Ball will initially be bouncing in.

sprite.name: Spiny Cheep Cheep
sprite.notes: A spiky version of the basic Cheep Cheep and its very similar brethren. When placed in water, it will swim along or even swim after the player.

dependency.notes: The Cheep Cheep will only spawn if placed within water. In addition, Type 1, 7, and 8 only work on non-location water.

checkbox.title: Swims Left
checkbox.comment: If checked, swims to the left. The fish will not swim backwards when you backtrack. If unchecked, it depends on the 'Type' set, in which Direction the Cheep Cheep swims first. For Types 3, 4, 6 and 7, it swims to the right in general. All other Types will cause the Cheep Cheeps to swim in Mario's Direction.

list.title: Type
list.comment:
Specifies the Swimming-'Type' that should be used for this Cheep Cheep. Deep Cheeps and Eep Cheeps only work in non-Location water. Value 5 is unique. Type-5 Cheep Cheeps will look into the camera until Mario comes close. Furthermore, the Direction will be ignored and the Cheep Cheep will always swim in the opposite Direction, away from Mario, but only if Mario is close enough.
Values marked with an asterisk (*) will ignore the speed Value set and instead will always use Value 1, no matter what is selected there. Also, all Values with (*) will let the Cheep Cheep swim in a wavy line (just as the Coin Cheep Cheep does).
The two Values with (**) follow exactly the same behavior as those marked with (*), only difference is its speed. Cheep Cheeps affected will swim slightly faster, both vertical and horizontal.

New naming scheme as of NSMBU:

Red = Cheep Cheep (normal)
Green = Deep Cheep (aggressive)
Yellow = Eep Cheep (shy)
list.entry: Spiny Cheep Cheep ("LrSwim"), Swims Left / Right
Spiny Cheep Cheep ("WaterWait"), Waits, Then Swims Straight**
Spiny Deep Cheep ("SrcSwim"), Follows Player Slightly*
Spiny Deep Cheep ("ScrSwim"), Follows Player Slightly*

list.title: Swim Speed
list.comment: This determines the swimming speed of [?????] Types of Cheep Cheep.
list.comment2: Note: Type-3 Cheep Cheeps (Swims Left / Right) have the same speed as values 1 and 2. [Both? What? Slow and Medium-Slow?]

list.title: Swim Distance
list.comment: This determines the distance that a Type 3 Cheep Cheep will swim in both directions from its initial placement.

value.title: 'Dodge' Event ID
value.comment:
Right, this does look weird at first glance, but it seems as if this function should work. It definitely has to do with Type 3 (Swims Left / Right). Treeki wrote this: 'LrSwim (Type 3) accepts an Event that will make the Cheep Cheep follow the player (turning state LrSwim into state LrSrcSwim)'.
If it really works is a good question.

sprite.name: Move-When-On Platform
sprite.notes: A special platform that will move at any point when a specified number of 'passengers' (players + enemies) are standing on it.

value.title: Length
value.comment: This value must be at least 1 to have collision.

dualbox.comment: When 'Does not Return' is checked, the platform will not stop moving once activated.

list.title: Moves with Passenger Number
list.comment: This determines how many 'passengers' are needed for the platform's movement to activate. A passenger can be many things. Examples include the players themselves, Goombas and other enemies, and even loose coins created by Fire Flowers. It will change colors from blue to red when this condition is satisfied.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: It will show an arrow pointing in the direction it is moving, whether it is moving this direction or returning.

value.title: Speed
value.comment: This determines the speed the platform will move.

sprite.name: Move-When-On Ghost House Box
sprite.notes: A special block that will move at any point when a specified number of 'passengers' (players + enemies) are standing on it.

list.title: Height
list.comment: This determines the height of the block.

list.title: Width
list.comment: This determines the width of the block.

checkbox.title: Does not Move
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the movement function of this block will be disabled making the block into a decorative object.

dualbox.comment: When 'Does not Return' is checked, the block will not stop moving once activated.

list.title: Moves with Passenger Number
list.comment: This determines how many 'passengers' are needed for the platform's movement to activate.
list.comment2: A passenger can be many things. Examples include the players themselves, Goombas and other enemies, and even loose coins created by Fire Flowers.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: This determines which direction the block will move when the Sprites Required value is satisfied.

value.title: Speed
value.comment: This determines the speed the block will move.

sprite.name: Long Skewer - Right
sprite.notes: A long spiked pillar that covers a distance of about 80 Blocks to the right. It has a fixed distance and fixed speed, but it is loaded no matter how far away from the player it is placed.

dualbox.comment: This determines the color of the Skewer.
dualbox.advancedcomment: Bug: The last loaded Long Skewer in the Area makes every other Long Skewer the same color.

value.title: Delay Before Launch
value.comment: This determines the delay before the Skewer shoots out in its direction. A value of 1 is 10 frames of delay. A reminder that the game runs at 60 frames per second, and the game's clock is 44 frames per tick.

value.title: Delay Before Return
value.comment: This determines the delay before the Skewer returns to its starting position. A value of 1 is 10 frames of delay. A reminder that the game runs at 60 frames per second, and the game's clock is 44 frames per tick.

checkbox.title: Make Sparks At End
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Skewer will throw off sparks when it reaches the end of its Travel Distance.
checkbox.comment2: When having two Skewers 'collide', it's recommended that only one have this setting.

checkbox.title: 'Silent' (Doesn't work)
checkbox.comment: This setting in normal Skewers disables all of its sound effects. However, this doesn't work with Long Skewers at all.

sprite.name: Effect - Airship Rocking
sprite.notes: When placed in a Zone, the camera will pan up and down about two blocks, used to simulate the effect of being on a ship. It cannot be used alongside the Auto-Scroller.

sprite.name: Long Skewer - Left
sprite.notes: A long spiked pillar that covers a distance of about 80 Blocks to the left. It has a fixed distance and fixed speed, but it is loaded no matter how far away from the player it is placed.

dualbox.comment: This determines the color of the Skewer.
dualbox.advancedcomment: Bug: The last loaded Long Skewer in the Area makes every other Long Skewer the same color.

value.title: Delay Before Launch
value.comment: This determines the delay before the Skewer shoots out in its direction. A value of 1 is 10 frames of delay. A reminder that the game runs at 60 frames per second, and the game's clock is 44 frames per tick.

value.title: Delay Before Return
value.comment: This determines the delay before the Skewer returns to its starting position. A value of 1 is 10 frames of delay. A reminder that the game runs at 60 frames per second, and the game's clock is 44 frames per tick.

checkbox.title: Make Sparks At End
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Skewer will throw off sparks when it reaches the end of its Travel Distance.
checkbox.comment2: When having two Skewers 'collide', it's recommended that only one have this setting.

checkbox.title: 'Silent' (Doesn't work)
checkbox.comment: This setting in normal Skewers disables all of its sound effects. However, this doesn't work with Long Skewers at all.

sprite.name: Massive Skewer - Down
sprite.notes: A massive spiked pillar that covers a distance of exactly 108 Blocks downwards. It has a fixed distance and fixed speed, but it is loaded no matter how far away from the player it is placed. The line displays the start-up distance of the Skewer, and the rectangle illustrates the Skewer's full path.

dualbox.comment: This determines the color of the Skewer.

value.title: Delay Before Launch
value.comment: This determines the delay before the Skewer shoots out in its direction. A value of 1 is 10 frames of delay. A reminder that the game runs at 60 frames per second, and the game's clock is 44 frames per tick.

value.title: Delay Before Return
value.comment: This determines the delay before the Skewer returns to its starting position. A value of 1 is 10 frames of delay. A reminder that the game runs at 60 frames per second, and the game's clock is 44 frames per tick.

checkbox.title: Make Sparks At End
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Skewer will throw off sparks when it reaches the end of its Travel Distance.
checkbox.comment2: When having two Skewers 'collide', it's recommended that only one have this setting.

checkbox.title: 'Silent' (Doesn't work)
checkbox.comment: This setting in normal Skewers disables all of its sound effects. However, this doesn't work with Massive Skewers at all.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 7 (1)
checkbox.advancedcomment: Used in Retail 07-24 as 1, no clear effect.

sprite.name: Line Controlled ? Block
sprite.notes: A variant of the ? Block that will ride along Line objects.

dependency.notes: Use the Group Controller [236] for spawn synchronization with other Group controlled sprites.

value.title: Group ID
value.comment: This pairs the block to a matching Group Controller for spawn synchronization with other Group controlled sprites.

list.title: Speed
list.comment: Line Controlled sprites use the same speed setting across all of them.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the block will move based on the Line that it is connected to.

list.title: Block Contains
list.comment: This determines what item the block contains.
list.comment2: This block will release as many items as there are players.

sprite.name: Line Controlled Brick Block
sprite.notes: A variant of the Brick Block that will ride along Line objects.

dependency.notes: Use the Group Controller [236] for spawn synchronization with other Group controlled sprites.

value.title: Group ID
value.comment: This pairs the block to a matching Group Controller for spawn synchronization with other Group controlled sprites.

list.title: Speed
list.comment: Line Controlled sprites use the same speed setting across all of them.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the block will move based on the Line that it is connected to.

list.title: Block Contains
list.comment: This determines what item the block contains.
list.comment2: This block will release only one power-up item.

sprite.name: Massive Skewer - Up
sprite.notes: A massive spiked pillar that covers a distance of exactly 108 Blocks upwards. It has a fixed distance and fixed speed, but it is loaded no matter how far away from the player it is placed. The line displays the start-up distance of the Skewer, and the rectangle illustrates the Skewer's full path.

dualbox.comment: This determines the color of the Skewer.

value.title: Delay Before Launch
value.comment: This determines the delay before the Skewer shoots out in its direction. A value of 1 is 10 frames of delay. A reminder that the game runs at 60 frames per second, and the game's clock is 44 frames per tick.

value.title: Delay Before Return
value.comment: This determines the delay before the Skewer returns to its starting position. A value of 1 is 10 frames of delay. A reminder that the game runs at 60 frames per second, and the game's clock is 44 frames per tick.

checkbox.title: Make Sparks At End
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Skewer will throw off sparks when it reaches the end of its Travel Distance.
checkbox.comment2: When having two Skewers 'collide', it's recommended that only one have this setting.

checkbox.title: 'Silent' (Doesn't work)
checkbox.comment: This setting in normal Skewers disables all of its sound effects. However, this doesn't work with Massive Skewers at all.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 7 (1)
checkbox.comment: Used in Retail 07-24 as 1, no clear effect.

sprite.name: Boss Controller - Bowser Jr. (2nd Battle)
sprite.notes: This controls the mechanics for the second Bowser Jr. Boss Fight in World 6. It spawns the backgrounds BgA_0B02 and BgB_5202, and will overlap any other backgrounds set in the zone. The white square indicates the placement for the Airship Boss Cutscene controller.

dependency.notes: Specific room settings are likely required. Please reference the original Retail level, 06-38 A1.

sprite.name: Boss Controller - Bowser Jr. (3rd Battle)
sprite.notes: This controls the mechanics for the third Bowser Jr. Boss Fight in World 8. It spawns the backgrounds BgA_5502 and BgB_4C02, and will overlap any other backgrounds set in the zone. The white square indicates the placement for the Airship Boss Cutscene controller.

dependency.notes: Specific room settings are likely required. Please reference the original Retail level, 08-38 A1.

sprite.name: Boss Controller - Castle Boss
sprite.yoshinotes: Yoshi plays an unused animation when he enters the area from a Boss Entrance. However, he lacks proper compatibility with the bosses themselves.
sprite.notes: This controls the various boss fight mechanics for the corresponding Koopaling boss fight, such as the cutscenes, boss movement, shutter doors, camera options, and boss collision when the fight begins.

dependency.notes: For help in placement of the Boss Controller and Koopaling Castle Boss, see the desired Castle Boss' room in the retail level.

list.title: Boss
list.comment: Select the boss that matches the setup you are creating.

sprite.name: Cutscene Controller - Bowser Jr and Peach at Castle
sprite.notes: This controller manages the Castle Boss's Airship cinematics and the level completion.

dependency.notes: For help in placement of the Boss Controllers and Cutscene Controllers, see the desired Castle's Boss Room in the Retail level.

list.title: Boss
list.comment: Select the boss that matches the setup you are creating.

sprite.name: Cutscene Controller - Bowser Jr and Peach at Airship
sprite.notes: This controller manages the Bowser Jr. cinematics and level completion, as well as the World 8 Airship transition segment. This sprite will be used twice in the Third Bowser Jr. Fight's arrangement.

dependency.notes: Specific room settings are likely required. Please reference the original Retail levels, 04-, 06-, and 08-38 A1.

list.title: Version
list.comment: This determines which version of the Bowser Jr. boss fight is being used.

sprite.name: Incomplete Sprite - 'Ac_Block_Group'
sprite.notes: Does nothing.

sprite.name: (Unused) Toad House Minigame - Lives Balloon
sprite.notes: An unused version of sprite 412 and has no purpose.

sprite.name: Toad House Minigame - Lives Balloon
sprite.notes: A colored balloon with a number on it that will award extra lives when shot by a Toad Cannon.

dependency.notes: It can be placed with or without Line objects. It requires both a Toad Cannon and a Cannon Minigame Controller in order to function properly.

checkbox.title: No Handle
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the balloon will not have a handle.
checkbox.comment2: Only balloons with handles can have a type other than 'Normal'.

list.title: Type
list.comment: This determines the secondary movement effect of the balloon.
list.comment2: A bobbing balloon will move up and down with its handle, a swaying balloon will swing left and right, and a spinning balloon will spin around in a circle.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the block will move based on the Line that it is connected to.

checkbox.title: Positional Offset
checkbox.comment: If set, the balloon is moved half a block to the right and half a block to the top.

sprite.name: Bouncing Wendy Ring
sprite.notes: A stand-alone version of the bouncing ring used in the Wendy Koopa boss fights.

list.title: Starting Direction
list.comment: This determines the direction the ring will initially be moving in.

dualbox.comment: The Spike will turn to face the player when on screen.

checkbox.title: Always Throwing
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Spike will always throw spiked balls, even when off-screen. May only function with Stone Spikes.

value.title: Throwing Delay
value.comment: The amount of delay is inconsistent between increases in value.

sprite.name: (Unused) Larry Koopa
sprite.notes: An unused and incomplete version of the Larry Koopa boss fight that stands still in place, even with a Tower or Castle Boss Controller attached. You can still put this sprite in a normal level without any additional setup. He can be defeated with Fire and Ice. If Mario jumps on him, Mario will get hit. Nonetheless, Mario can do a Ground-Pound to defeat him immediately. Larry just stands there and waits...

sprite.name: Invisible 1-Up - Mini-Mario Only
sprite.notes: A stationary invisible 1-up Mushroom that can only be collected by a player with the Mini power-up.

sprite.name: Invisible Spin-Jump Coin
sprite.notes: A loose Coin appears if you spin-jump near this sprite, identical to the effect of spin-jumping near a dancing flower.

sprite.name: Homing Banzai Bill Spawner
sprite.notes: This sprite spawns endless homing Banzai Bills from the sprite's placement. There is no cannon for them to appear from, though the sound effect is played. Once they spawn, they will rise or fall vertically until they lock onto a player, and then they will begin to move forward.

value.title: Delay Between Firing
value.comment: This determines how long the game will wait before firing another Banzai Bill.
value.comment2: A value of 16-24 is recommended.

sprite.name: Bowser
sprite.notes: Bowser himself, used in the final boss fight of World 8. He cannot be used without the proper controllers and level setup. On his own, he has no collision and simply looks at the player.

dependency.notes: Most of the final Bowser fight involves hardcoded elements, so directly copying 08-24 A4 is strongly recommended.

sprite.name: Lighting - Giant Glow Block
sprite.notes: A large glow block that cannot be picked up. Instead, it moves like a platform and can also be turned on and off.

dependency.notes: The effect of this sprite is diminished if not using Full Darkness lighting. It must have a Triggering Event ID of at least 1, even if it is set to Always On, or it will not load. It also must be paired with a movement controller in order to function.

list.title: Activation Mode
list.comment: This determines if the glow block is naturally on, or if it is event controlled.

value.title: Triggering Event ID (VALUE REQUIRED)
value.comment: This determines which Event must be activated for the block to glow, and it must be set to at least 1 event if the Activation Mode is set to Always On.

list.title: Movement Type
list.comment: This determines the movement behavior of the glow block.
list.comment2: All movement types require a matching movement controller, and at least one type of movement controller is required for the sprite to function.

value.title: Path Movement ID
value.comment: If pairing the glow block with Sprite 159, match the Path Movement ID to enable Path controlled movement.

value.title: Two Way Line ID
value.comment: If pairing the glow block with sprite 260, match the Two Way Line ID to enable Two Way synchronized movement.

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: If pairing the glow block with sprite 96 or 149, match the Rotation ID to allow enable Rotation controlled movement.

sprite.name: (Unused) Fake Ghost House Door
sprite.notes: A stand-alone version of the 'Fake Door' effect from the normal Ghost House Door.

sprite.name: Toad Needs Help - ? Block
sprite.notes: A feature used in Retail's Single Player where a Toad bubble will appear on the world map and signal that it needs rescued. Playing and completing that level by finding this Toad will award Mario three 1-Ups if he is carried to the goal flag in Super Form, and one 1-Up in Small Form. Also, when Toad is saved, a Toad House will open at the starting point of the world. The type of house that appears depends on the last digit in the time limit when Toad and/or Mario touches the flagpole.

dependency.notes: All normal levels can have a Toad Needs Help block and end up needing rescued, but they will not appear for Ghost House, Tower, Castle, or Airship levels.

checkbox.title: Small Size
checkbox.comment: Changes the size of the Toad to be small (1 tile large).

sprite.name: Toad Needs Help - Brick Block
sprite.notes: A feature used in Retail's Single Player where a Toad bubble will appear on the world map and signal that it needs rescued. Playing and completing that level by finding this Toad will award Mario three 1-Ups if he is carried to the goal flag in Super Form, and one 1-Up in Small Form. Also, when Toad is saved, a Toad House will open at the starting point of the world. The type of house that appears depends on the last digit in the time limit when Toad and/or Mario touches the flagpole.

dependency.notes: All normal levels can have a Toad Needs Help block and end up needing rescued, but they will not appear for Ghost House, Tower, Castle, or Airship levels.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 12 (1)
checkbox.comment: ASM shows Nybble 12 might affect something.

sprite.name: Palm Tree
sprite.notes: A palm tree decoration with a solid-on-top collision.

list.title: Height
list.comment: This determines the height of the Palm Tree.

sprite.name: Jellybeam
sprite.notes: A jellyfish enemy that produces a varying cone of light.

dependency.notes: Unlike most lighting related sprites, the Jellybeam MUST be accompanied by Full Darkness light mode or else it will cause bugs/glitches. While it can be used without water, the use of water is still suggested.

list.title: Delay Before Dropping
list.comment: This determines the delay before the Jellybeam swims downwards.

value.title: Distance Dropped
value.comment: This determines the amount of additional distance the Jellybeam will swim downwards.

sprite.name: Fireball Spawn Area
sprite.notes: Assigns a spawn area where loose Fireballs will spawn from the side of the screen while a player is inside it. The fireballs are unaffected by terrain and will travel across the entire screen unhindered.

dependency.notes: The fireballs will spawn from the specified side of the screen at the same vertical height as the sprite's placement, and move across the screen in a horizontal line.

value.title: Location ID
value.comment: The Fireballs will only spawn while a player is in this location.

list.title: Rate of Fire
list.comment: This determines the frequency of fireball spawns.
list.comment2: The delay isn't quite in game seconds, instead each value other than 0 is a fraction of value 1. In retail, Nintendo used 12 and 14.

dualbox.comment: This determines which side of the screen the fireballs will appear from.

sprite.name: Kamek
sprite.notes: Requires his boss controller to function. His spawn position is fixed relative to the boss controller's position, making the placement of the sprite itself irrelevant.

dependency.notes: For more help setting up the boss room, see the zone from the original game.

sprite.name: Toad House Minigame - Flip Panel
sprite.notes: One of the item panels used in the Flip Panel minigame.

dependency.notes: All 6 Variants must be properly set, as the game will select one of them at random. It's recommended to use 3-4 different items in even quantities, and exactly 2 Bowsers and 2 Bowser Jr's in each set. Additionally, you must use exactly 18 panels, and every panel must have a unique ID from 0-17.

list.title: Minigame Variant #1
list.comment: This determines the item shown during the first Flip Panel minigame variant.

list.title: Minigame Variant #2
list.comment: This determines the item shown during the second Flip Panel minigame variant.

list.title: Minigame Variant #3
list.comment: This determines the item shown during the third Flip Panel minigame variant.

list.title: Minigame Variant #4
list.comment: This determines the item shown during the fourth Flip Panel minigame variant.

list.title: Minigame Variant #5
list.comment: This determines the item shown during the fifth Flip Panel minigame variant.

list.title: Minigame Variant #6
list.comment: This determines the item shown during the sixth Flip Panel minigame variant.

value.title: Panel ID
value.comment: This determines the ID of the panel for the purposes of the minigame controller.
value.comment2: See Dependency Notes for information on setting this up, or reference a retail 0X-27 level.

sprite.name: Toad House Minigame - Cannon Controller
sprite.notes: This controls the minigame functionality of the Cannon minigame for extra lives found in Toad Houses.

dependency.notes: This must be included with a proper Cannon balloon room in order for the minigame to function correctly.

sprite.name: Toad House Minigame - Flip Panel Controller
sprite.notes: This controls the minigame functionality of the Flip Panel minigame for items found in Toad Houses.

dependency.notes: This must be included with a proper Flip Panel room in order for the minigame to function correctly.

sprite.name: Boss Controller - Bowser
sprite.notes: The main boss controller for the Retail Bowser battle. It will override the Zone's camera settings.

dependency.notes: Most of the final Bowser fight involves hardcoded elements, so directly copying 08-24 A4 is strongly recommended. The Basic Platform listed is required for Bowser half-way in the fight to move onto the 2nd phase. The direction it heads controls the camera until it leaves the Zone. The Locations from the original level do not affect the fight, and were likely included to aid the developers visualize different parts of the fight.

sprite.name: Toad NPC
sprite.notes: A non-interactive Toad that will turn and face the player. A few sprites rely on its presence in a level to work.

sprite.name: Floating ? Block
sprite.notes: A slightly-larger-than-normal ? Block that floats on the surface of the Zone's non-Location Water, Raft Water, Poisoned Water, or Lava.

dependency.notes: Place this block at the horizontal position you want it to load, and it will spawn floating at the surface line of the body of liquid. It only works with the non-Location liquid sprites listed below.

list.title: Block Contains
list.comment: This determines what item the block contains.
list.comment2: This block will release as many items as there are players.

sprite.name: Warp Cannon
sprite.notes: A large cannon that will flag a level for completion.

list.title: Inscription
list.comment: This determines which number is printed on the side of the giant cannon.
list.comment2: The level that the cannon actually travels to is hardcoded in Retail NSMBW based on its course ID. Changing this setting will not change the destination.

sprite.name: Effect - Ghost Fog
sprite.notes:
This adds a thin wispy fog effect to the level that can be used with or without a Location ID.
The fog will make non-location Lava/Poisoned Water function just like Water if it is added into the level after the liquids. You can avoid this by adding the fog and then re-adding the Lava/Poisoned Water, or by placing the liquids in their own separate locations.

value.title: Location ID
value.comment: This determines the location in which the Ghost Fog will spawn.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 10 (4)
checkbox.advancedcomment: This sprite may support the Water property of being able to be placed behind the main layer by enabling this. It is not tested, however, and may not function.

sprite.name: Background Parallax Center Point
sprite.notes: This will center the scrolling of the Zone's backgrounds at the placement of the sprite.

dependency.notes: This sprite will affect the background's parallax settings by setting the center point at the placement of the sprite. Do not use more than one [436] per Zone.

list.title: Boss Related: Alignment
list.comment: This will slightly adjust the Y-Axis alignment, and should be set appropriately when creating a boss room.

sprite.name: Climbable Striped Pole
sprite.notes: A stationary purple striped pole that can be climbed up. This does not count as a climbing animation for the IF Event Controller. It counts as being in the air.

dependency.notes: This sprite must be placed evenly on the grid in order to function properly.

value.title: Height
value.comment: This determines the height of the pole.

sprite.name: Rotation Controlled Cage Blocks
sprite.notes: A large textured block meant for use with a Spinning rotation controller. It has several different shapes and poses a challenging obstacle when trying to climb it.

dependency.notes: This block does not appear unless actually paired to a rotation controller.

list.title: Type
list.comment: This determines the shape of the block.

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: This pairs the platform to a matching rotation controller.

sprite.name: Peach in Cage - Fake
sprite.notes: Kamek sitting inside of a cage dressed like Peach.

dependency.notes: While it can be used as decoration, it doesn't do anything special unless it's part of the Bowser Boss fight.

sprite.name: Climbable Horizontal Rope
sprite.notes: A horizontal rope that the player will hang from and slowly move across. This does not count as a climbing animation for the IF Event Controller. It counts as being in the air.

value.title: Length
value.comment: This determines the length of the rope.

sprite.name: Mushroom Platform
sprite.notes: A mushroom platform with a solid-on-top collision representing the top segment of a large mushroom. The stem portion must be painted with tileset objects.

dualbox.comment: This determines the thickness (style) of the mushroom platform.
This determines the color of the Skinny mushroom platform.
This determines the color of the Thick mushroom platform.

value.title: Width
value.comment: This determines the width of the mushroom platform.

checkbox.title: Place In Front Of Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-Order of the platform placing it in front of other sprites.
checkbox.comment2: The player will jump behind the mushroom platform when passing through from underneath.

sprite.name: Hint Movie Block Controller
sprite.notes: A controller for the Hint Movie block.

dependency.notes: As it is currently impossible to meet the replay dependency, this sprite should not be used.

sprite.name: Hint Movie Block
sprite.notes: A block that loads a menu of special replays.

dependency.notes: As it is currently impossible to meet the replay dependency, this sprite should not be used.

sprite.name: Climbable Swinging Vine - Already Swinging
sprite.notes: A swinging vine that loads in with a small amount of momentum already applied to it. Not especially useful compared to [464]. This does not count as a climbing animation for the IF Event Controller. It counts as being in the air.

sprite.name: Peach in Cage - Real
sprite.notes: Peach standing inside of a cage.

dependency.notes: While it can be used as decoration, it doesn't do anything special unless it's part of the Bowser Boss fight.

sprite.name: Effect - Light Cloud Area
sprite.notes: This adds a light cloud effect to the level. It must use a Location ID.

checkbox.title: Death Clouds
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the cloud area will produce purple instant death clouds instead of normal white clouds.

value.title: Location ID
value.comment: This determines the location in which the cloud effect will appear.

sprite.name: Lighting - Underwater Lamp
sprite.notes: A decorative aquatic lamp that generates light around it. It has no collision by default. It does not have to be used with water, it just happens to have a ship motif.

sprite.name: Metal Bar
sprite.notes: A metal bar that is essentially just a 5x2 block.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Chainlink Fence
checkbox.comment: When enabled, every part of the metal bar that is touching a fence tile has no collision on the frontside of chainlink fences. This also changes the relative Z-Order of the bar to -2500, placing it further behind other sprites.

value.title: Useless Value 11
value.comment: Used in Retail (04-24 A1), but the game's code never reads this value.

checkbox.title: Useless Flag 12 (1)
checkbox.comment: Used in Retail (04-24 A1), but the game's code never reads this value.

sprite.name: Bowser Fireball Spawn Area
sprite.notes: Assigns a spawn area where Bowser Fireballs will fire from the screen's right edge towards the left while a player is inside it.
sprite.advancednotes:
- Uses hardcoded location ID 0 (you can have multiple ones in the zone)
- They will look awful if Bowser's sprite isn't present in any area of the level

Sprite Placement:
- X Position does not matter
- Y Position matters, as the sprite will spawn fireballs in a range of 6 tiles below its placement

Location Placement:
- Bowser Fireballs start spawning as soon as the left edge of the location enters the screen

Location Size (fireballs won't spawn if requirements aren't met):
- X Size: Unknown, but a specific minimal X location size is required for the Bowser Fireballs to spawn correctly.
- Y Size: At least 120px (5 blocks). A specific minimal Y location size is required for the Bowser Fireballs to spawn correctly.

dependency.notes: Almost all settings are hardcoded and the sprite will not function outside of the exact setup used in 8-24 A4. See advanced notes for more information.

checkbox.title: Enable Functionality
checkbox.comment: This must be enabled for the sprite to function.

value.title: Location ID
value.comment: Only works with hardcoded location ID 0! The Fireballs will only spawn while a player is in this location.
value.advancedcomment: Or at least, it would, if its behavior had not been hardcoded.

value.title: Number of Fireballs
value.comment: This determines the number of fireballs in each wave.
value.comment2: A value of 0 creates 5 fireballs. A value of 1+ creates that number.

value.title: Positioning
value.comment: Changes position the Fireballs appear in.
value.comment2: A value of 0 creates random patterns. A value of 1 will CRASH the game. A value of 2+ will change the positioning or patterns or something.

sprite.name: Enterable Warp Pipe - Up
sprite.notes: A non-tileset pipe that can be entered or exited from. Only one facing upwards exists. It does not have to be placed exactly on the grid.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the Pipe.

value.title: Length
value.comment: This determines the length of the Pipe.

value.title: Entrance ID
value.comment: This determines which Entrance is paired with the pipe.

sprite.name: Scaredy Rat Despawner
sprite.notes: A decorative mouse hole with a secondary function. It will despawn Scaredy Rats that pass through it.

dependency.notes: This has the ability to despawn two different sprites.

sprite.name: Bowser Boss Door
sprite.notes: A very large green door that can have an Entrance placed on it.

sprite.name: Seaweed Plant
sprite.notes: A decorative seaweed plant that sways lightly back and forth.

list.title: Size
list.comment: This determines the size of the seaweed.

sprite.name: Ambush Level Controller
sprite.notes: This controls the miscellaneous behaviors of an Ambush level, including the Toad Balloons, the Chest, and the destruction of the enemies.

dependency.notes: The Ambush Level Controller, 8 Toad Balloons, and a Toad House Chest with proper settings are all required in order for an Ambush to function.

value.title: Unknown Value 11-12
value.advancedcomment: ASM shows Nybble 11-12 might affect something. Value 0-254.

sprite.name: Rotation Controlled Hanging Sledge Block
sprite.notes: A hanging sledge hammer type block that can be paired with rotation controllers.

dependency.notes: This block does not appear unless actually paired to a rotation controller.

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: This pairs the block to a matching rotation controller.

sprite.name: Final Boss - Bridge Pieces
sprite.notes: The pieces of the bridge used during the final boss battle against Bowser.

dependency.notes: The falling behavior can only be achieved when part of the Bowser Boss Battle arrangement. However, it can still be used as a decorative portion of a level.

list.title: Piece
list.comment: This determines which piece of the bridge is used.

sprite.name: Rotation Controlled 4-Way Thin Bar
sprite.notes: A block with four thin bars protruding from it that can be paired with rotation controllers.

dependency.notes: This block does not appear unless actually paired to a rotation controller.

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: This pairs the block to a matching rotation controller.

sprite.name: Rotation Controlled Metal Bar
sprite.notes: A very large metal bar block that can be paired with rotation controllers. It is approximately 22 blocks long by 4 blocks wide. It will load just slightly behind Layer 1 terrain.

dependency.notes: This block does not appear unless actually paired to a rotation controller.

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: This pairs the block to a matching rotation controller.

sprite.name: Crowd Clapping Controller for Coin Collection #1
sprite.notes: A controller that generates a clapping sound when the player collects the listed number of coins of both types from the Collection ID group.

dependency.notes: You cannot use tileset coins for this to function.

value.title: # of Blue Coins Required
value.comment: This determines the number of paired blue coins required to trigger the Crowd Clapper.

value.title: # of Yellow Coins Required
value.comment: This determines the number of paired standard coins required to trigger the Crowd Clapper.

value.title: Collection ID
value.comment: This pairs matching Coins with the Crowd Clapper to track their collection.

sprite.name: Silver Gear Block - Two Way Line
sprite.notes: A large rectangular block with a silver gear motif as decoration. It can only be paired for Two Way Line movement. If linked with an Event Activated Two Way Line controller, the Silver Gear Block will only spawn when the event is activated.

dependency.notes: This block must be paired with a [260] Two Way Line movement controller in order to spawn and function. ID 0 works with this sprite.

value.title: Two Way Line ID
value.comment: This pairs the block to a matching Two Way Line movement controller.

checkbox.title: Upside-Down
checkbox.comment: Flips the block upside down. This doesn't affect its movement.

sprite.name: Crowd Clapping Controller for Coin Collection #2
sprite.notes: A controller that generates a clapping sound when the player collects the listed number of coins of both types from the Collection ID group. Seems to be identical to #1.

value.title: # of Blue Coins Required
value.comment: This determines the number of paired blue coins required to trigger the Crowd Clapper.

value.title: # of Yellow Coins Required
value.comment: This determines the number of paired standard coins required to trigger the Crowd Clapper.

value.title: Collection ID
value.comment: This pairs matching Coins with the Crowd Clapper to track their collection.

sprite.name: Enormous Tower Block with Spikes
sprite.notes: A very large block that is decorated with the Pa1_toride (Tower) tileset. This appearance is hardcoded and not pulled directly from the tileset. The Sprite's placement represents the upper left corner of the block.

list.title: Size
list.comment: This determines the size of the block

dualbox.comment: This determines the initial direction the block will travel.

value.title: Delay Before Movement
value.comment: This determines how long the block will wait before making its outwards movement.
value.comment2: Each value is equal to two game seconds.

value.title: Distance
value.comment: This defines how many tiles the block will move before returning to its starting position.

value.title: Delay Before Return
value.comment: This determines how long the block will wait before making its return movement.
value.comment2: Each value is equal to two game seconds.

list.title: Speed
list.comment: This determines the speed of the block's movement.

dualbox.comment: This determines which side of the block has spikes.

sprite.name: Climbable Swinging Vine/Chain
sprite.notes: A swinging vine or chain that can be grabbed onto by the player and made to swing left and right. This does not count as a climbing animation for the IF Event Controller. It counts as being in the air.

dualbox.comment: This determines which type of visuals are used for the swinging object.

value.title: Unknown Value 6
value.advancedcomment: Nintendo uses value 1 in 5-01 A1. No visible effect.

sprite.name: Effect - Ambiance Sound Effects
sprite.notes: This generates various ambiance effects for the Zone, such as birds and thunder.

dependency.notes: If this sprite is placed more than once in the same Zone, the game will crash.

list.title: Type
list.comment: This determines the ambiance used in the Zone.

sprite.name: Moving Lava Glow Metal Block
sprite.notes: A tall block with the glow of lava underneath it that moves back and forth.

list.title: Movement Direction
list.comment: This determines the initial direction the block will travel.

value.title: Delay Before Movement
value.comment: This determines how long the block will wait before making its outwards movement.
value.comment2: Each value is equal to two game seconds.

value.title: Delay Before Return
value.comment: This determines how long the block will wait before making its return movement.
value.comment2: Each value is equal to two game seconds.

sprite.name: Moving Light Gem Block
sprite.notes: A small block with a triangular gem in it that lights up just before it moves from its starting position, and then deactivates instantly when it begins to move back.

list.title: Initial Direction
list.comment: This determines the initial direction the block will travel. The block's gem will light up when travelling in this direction.

value.title: Delay Before Movement
value.comment: This determines how long the block will wait before making its outwards movement.
value.comment2: Each value is equal to two game seconds.

value.title: Delay Before Return
value.comment: This determines how long the block will wait before making its return movement.
value.comment2: Each value is equal to two game seconds.

sprite.name: Cutscene Controller - Credits
sprite.notes: This controller manages the game's credits and staffroll after the final Bowser fight.

dependency.notes: There are several hardcoded dependencies involved in this, so it is not usable outside of the established level and arrangement. The Staffroll credits themselves however have an editor available for them.

sprite.name: Bolt Controlled Airship Platform
sprite.notes: An airship platform that can also be made to move by spinning a Bolt. It can only move in a downwards direction.

dependency.notes: This platform is intended to function as a pair with two [470] Airship Platform Wires. Additionally, it must be paired to a [315] Bolt in order to function.

value.title: Bolt ID
value.comment: This pairs the platform with a matching Bolt.

checkbox.title: Moves from Bolt
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the metal block will move when the matching Bolt is spun.
checkbox.comment2: The platform can only be made to move downwards.

list.title: Width
list.comment: This determines the width of the platform.

sprite.name: Bolt Controlled Airship Platform Wire
sprite.notes: A wire that matches the motif of the Airship Platform that can be made to move by spinning a Bolt. It can only move in a downwards direction.

dependency.notes: Two of these decorative wires are intended to function as a pair with the [469] Airship Platform. Additionally, it must be paired to a [315] Bolt in order to function.

value.title: Bolt ID
value.comment: This pairs the wire with a matching Bolt.

checkbox.title: Moves from Bolt
checkbox.comment: Check this to cause the Sprite to move when the Bolt is spun.

sprite.name: Moving Pot on a Bolt Platform
sprite.notes: A pot that rests on top of a large colorful bolt, and moves down and then up again. The bolt cannot be passed through.

value.title: Delay Before Moving Down
value.comment: This determines how long the platform will wait before making its downwards movement.
value.comment2: Each value is equal to two game seconds.

value.title: Distance
value.comment: This defines how many tiles the platform will move before returning to its starting position.

value.title: Delay Before Moving Up
value.comment: This determines how long the platform will wait before making its upwards movement.
value.comment2: Each value is equal to two game seconds.

list.title: Speed
list.comment: This determines the speed of the platform's movement.

sprite.name: Ice Floe Spawner
sprite.notes: This generates 'cylindrical' Ice Blocks of a random size that slide across the ground from the right to the left.

dependency.notes: They will spawn from the sprite's placement and fall to the nearest ground under the sprite placement. They will destroy breakable and explodable blocks placed against the ground line and will come to a complete stop when encountering any other terrain. Following that, they start to stack up, making it preferred that they have a pit to fall through. They are half in the air, half embedded in the ground when interacting with slopes, but they will make use of them.

sprite.name: Floating Ice Floe Spawner
sprite.notes: This generates 'cylindrical' Ice Blocks of a random size that float across the surface of a liquid from the right to the left.

dependency.notes: They will spawn from the sprite's placement and fall or float to the liquid's surface. They will bob up and down with momentum and weight when they do this. They will move through all terrain. While it does function with Lava, it looks rather strange, thematically. Therefore it is only recommended to use this with Water and Poisoned Water. It does work with Moving Water, as well.

sprite.name: Dancing Coin/Block Controller
sprite.notes: This is the controller that operates 'Dancing' and 'Dancing (Reversed) standard Coins and Blocks. Dancing Coins/Blocks will quickly sway left to right two blocks in distance while dipping slightly downwards about half a block.

dependency.notes: Only one Dancing controller is needed per Zone. It is recommended to place it nearby the Zone's entrance, but it can exist anywhere.

sprite.name: Path Controlled Ice Floe
sprite.notes: A stand-alone Ice Floe that can travel along an assigned Path.

value.title: Path ID
value.comment: This determines the ID of the Path that the Ice Floe will be linked to, although the sprite works fine without one. Additionally, the Ice Floe will move at the speed of the Path it's linked to.

value.title: Starting Node
value.comment: This determines the Node of the Path that the Ice Floe will appear at and start moving from.

list.title: Size
list.comment: This determines the size of the Ice Floe.

checkbox.title: Floating
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Ice Floe will wiggle around as though it is floating on the surface of the water.

sprite.name: Loose Flying Wrench
sprite.notes: A stand-alone Rocky Wrench's wrench that will fly across the screen.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the wrench flies in when it loads.

sprite.name: Super Guide Block
sprite.notes: A block that activates a special Luigi replay where Luigi will complete the level as minimally as possible with as little running or wall jumping as he can get away with.

dependency.notes: This block cannot currently be utilized, as there is no tool to create and assign replays. As a result, do NOT use this block in your levels, and if you edit a Retail level, you need to remove this block.

checkbox.title: Glows
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the block will glow and emit light in Full Darkness.

checkbox.title: Loads at Midway
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the block will only appear if the level has been loaded from a Midway point.

sprite.name: Bowser Switch (Small)
sprite.notes: This switch is nearly identical to the Red ! Switch, but it does not activate outlined Red Blocks. It may have additional bugs. Not recommended for use outside of the final Bowser Boss fight.

dependency.notes: This sprite has additional hardcoded behavior that may cause bugs when it is used outside of its intended boss fight.

checkbox.title: Upside-Down
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will be facing downwards.
checkbox.comment2: Upside-Down switches cannot be set to fall.

checkbox.title: Falls
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will be movable by environmental factors, such as dropping down when bricks below it are destroyed, or moving along platforms.
checkbox.comment2: Conveyor belts cannot move Switches, even when [Falls] is set.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: This event will be modified when the switch is pressed. An event is not required if simply using the switch to activate Red Blocks.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Target Event is modified.
dualbox.comment2: The Target Event will be modified to the opposite state when the Timed effect expires.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Target Event is modified.
This determines if the Target Event is modified temporarily or permanently.
dualbox.comment2: Permanent Event cannot be used with Multi-Use. Additionally, Permanent Event will also permanently deactivate the background music for the zone, and Red Blocks will not become solid.

checkbox.title: Disable Music Interruption
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will not interrupt the normal level music with Timed music. This setting is only applicable if Timed Event is set.

checkbox.title: Disable Permanent Music Interruption
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will not disable the background music. This setting is highly recommended if Permanent Event is set.

dualbox.comment: This determines if the switch will pop back up when the Timed effect expires.
dualbox.comment2:
Single Use: The switch will vanish entirely after pressed.

Multi-Use: The switch will enter a flat state. When the Timed effect expires, the switch will pop back up following the Delay setting.
dualbox.advancedcomment:
If the Target Event is deactivated/activated by another method, Multi-Use switches will flatten or pop-up on their own.

The pop up effect can be used to launch the player much higher than they could normally jump.

list.title: Delay on Multi-Use
list.comment: This determines how long the switch will take to pop up after the timer expires on a Timed Multi-Use switch.

checkbox.title: Loads at Midway
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will only appear if the level has been loaded from a Midway point.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This switch will not be visible if a Triggering Event is defined unless that event is activated.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This switch will not be visible if a Triggering Event is defined unless that event is activated.
value.advancedcomment: Using a Triggering ID with Multi-Use functionality is somewhat glitchy and not recommended.

sprite.name: Bowser Switch (Large)
sprite.notes: A much larger, fancier switch that was originally used for the final Bowser Boss fight. It always flashes red.

dependency.notes: This sprite has additional hardcoded behavior that may cause bugs when it is used outside of its intended boss fight. Known bugs: It is incompatible with Multi-Use. The Target Event ID must be unique to this Switch.

checkbox.title: Upside-Down
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will be facing downwards.
checkbox.comment2: Upside-Down switches cannot be set to fall.

checkbox.title: Falls
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will be movable by environmental factors, such as dropping down when bricks below it are destroyed, or moving along platforms.
checkbox.comment2: Conveyor belts cannot move Switches, even when [Falls] is set.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: This event will be modified when the switch is pressed. An event is not required if simply using the switch to activate Red Blocks.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Target Event is modified.
dualbox.comment2: The Target Event will be modified to the opposite state when the Timed effect expires.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Target Event is modified.
This determines if the Target Event is modified temporarily or permanently.
dualbox.comment2: Permanent Event cannot be used with Multi-Use. Additionally, Permanent Event will also permanently deactivate the background music for the zone, and Red Blocks will not become solid.

checkbox.title: Disable Music Interruption
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will not interrupt the normal level music with Timed music. This setting is only applicable if Timed Event is set.

checkbox.title: Disable Permanent Music Interruption
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will not disable the background music. This setting is highly recommended if Permanent Event is set.

dualbox.comment: This determines if the switch will pop back up when the Timed effect expires.
dualbox.comment2:
Single Use: The switch will vanish entirely after pressed.

Multi-Use: The switch will enter a flat state. When the Timed effect expires, the switch will pop back up following the Delay setting.
dualbox.advancedcomment:
If the Target Event is deactivated/activated by another method, Multi-Use switches will flatten or pop-up on their own.

The pop up effect can be used to launch the player much higher than they could normally jump.

checkbox.title: Loads at Midway
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will only appear if the level has been loaded from a Midway point.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This switch will not be visible if a Triggering Event is defined unless that event is activated.

sprite.name: Morton's Skewer
sprite.notes: A spiked pillar for the Morton Koopa Tower Boss fight with a large amount of control over the timing values. It first extends 1 block down, and then goes the rest of the way down after a slight delay.

dependency.notes: This spiked pillar will only move once Morton does his start-up animation when paired with his Tower Boss Controller.

value.title: Initial Launch Delay
value.comment: This determines the launch delay prior to the first time the pillar moves.
value.comment2: A value of 4 is equal to one game second.

value.title: Launch Delay
value.comment: This determines the launch delay after the first time the pillar moves.
value.comment2: A value of 64 is equal to one game second. A value of 255 is equal to four game seconds.

value.title: Return Delay
value.comment: This determines the return delay after the pillar moves.
value.comment2: A value of 64 is equal to one game second. A value of 255 is equal to four game seconds.

sprite.name: (Unused) Final Boss - Rubble Block
sprite.notes: A completely useless piece of decoration that was not directly used in the final Bowser Boss fight.

dependency.notes: While it can be placed, it only has two variants, has no collision, and requires Bowser in the level in order to function. It may be indirectly called on during the actual Bowser battle, however.

list.title: Size
list.comment: This determines the size of the decoration
list.comment2: Higher values crash the game.

value.title: Horizontal 'Jump' speed
value.comment: ASM shows Nybble 7-8 might affect something.

value.title: Vertical 'Jump' speed
value.comment: ASM shows Nybble 9-10 might affect something.

sprite.name: Final Boss - Pre-Boss Camera Effects
sprite.notes: A set of special elements utilized by the sections of level leading up to the final Bowser Boss fight.

list.title: Effect
list.comment: This determines the type of effect used. Other values not listed here crash the game.
